crime: No1/44 - 14th September 1753 - For unlawfully breaking and entering the common of Charles Lawrence, Esq, and takaing and carrying away one Oaken Tree val 5s, the property of said Charles. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1753.
No2/5 - 12th November 1749 - for stealing a peck and a half of partly winnowed wheat value 1s-3d, the goods of person unknown. Bill to be found at Xmas 1749.
No3/54 - 23 December 1755 - For assaulting Reymundo Putt, esq, a Justice of the Peace in the execution of his office - 2nd count for Common Assault. Bill to be found at Xmas 1755.

person: John Allen of Thorncombe Petty Constable
crime: No5 - Presented by Edward Knight, H. Constable for not retg [returning] list of Jurors. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1756.
No7/24 - For assaulting Elizabeth the wife of Hugh Gundry 13th August 1759. Traversed Xmas 1760. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1759. Tried Easter 1760 and found Guilty and fined 0s-1d.
No8/44 - 24th December 1763 - For stealing 2 Geese val 4s the goods of John Sefre. Bill to be found at Xmas 1764.

No9/168 - 29th March 1766 - For refusing to apprehend Thomas Harris having a warrant from William Hawker, esq, so to do for Bastardy. Traversed Midsummer 1766. Bill to be found at Easter 1766. Tried Michaelmas 1766 and found Not Guilty.
No10/125 - 24th December 1763 - For unlawfully permitting Isaac Woodsford in his custody for a ffelony to escape and go at large. Bill to be found at Xmas 1764.
No11/6 - 23rd December 1749 - For assaulting Henry Carslake. Traversed Xmas 1749. Bill to be found at Xmas 1749.

person: Thomas Leat of Membury Soap Boiler
crime: No12/65 - 19th February 1766 - For forcibly obstructing and hindering William Newberry one of the Tythingmen of Stockland in Dorset from carrying Stephen Manning before a Justice of the Peace being apprehended by a warrant in Bastardy. Traversed Easter 1766. Bill to be found at Easter 1766. Tried Midsummer 1766 and found Guilty and fined 0-0-1d.
No72 - 5th July 1766 - For stealing one Holland Shirt val 1s the goods of Thomas Smith. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1766. Tried Midsummer 1766 and found Guilty. To be whipped and discharged.

person: John Parker Junr of Honiton Labourer
crime: No14 - 1st August 1766 - For stealing two Loaves of Bread val 1s the goods of Benjamine Westcott. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1766. Tried Michaelmas 1766 and found Guilty - value 6d. To be whipped and discharged.
No14 - 5th April 1766 - For erecting a Causway at Membury and thereby diverting a watercourse. Bill to be found at Michaemas 1766. Tried Midsummer 1767. Pleads at Midsummer that his name is Stephen.
No16 - 12th January 1767 - For stealing Five loaves of bread val 2s-6d the goods of Joseph Davy. Bill to be found at Xmas 1767. Tried Xmas 1767 and found Guilty val 10d. Transported for Seven Years.
No17 - 20th November 1766 - For stealing 4 Wt of Beef val 9d ye goods of Bartholomew Dare. Bill to be found at Xmas 1767. Tried Xmas 1767 and found Guilty. To be Whipped and Discharged.

No18 - 24th December 1766 - For stealing one Silver Soop Spoon val 20s and two Silver Table Spoons val 10s the goods of Thomas Parker. Bill to be found at Xmas 1767. Tried Xmas 1767 and found Guilty val 10d. Transported for Seven Years.

No231/19 - of Axminster Yeoman - 27th March 1767 - For a forcible entry into a Cottage Garden and Plott of ground in Uplyme in the possession of Elianor Beves widow, and unlawfully taking and carrying away divers of her goods of the val £10. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1767. Tried at Easter 1767 and quashed on the motion of the Prosecutor at Michaelmas Sessions 1767. Case retried at Xmas and Easter 1768. Robert Cross fined 1d, the remaining defendants each fined 6d.

person: Joan Trott wife of David Trott
crime: No246/23 - 26th January 1767 - For assaulting William Matthews and rescuing divers Household and other Goods of the said David Trott distrained by the said William Matthews for £1-10s-0d for 3/4 of a years rent. Traversed Easter and Xmas 1768. Bills to be found at Midsummer 1767. Tried at Midsummer and Easter 1768. David Trott fined 6d, Joan Trott found Not Guilty.

No29 - 1st February 1767 - For stealing one Wooden Door val 5s and 20lb wt of iron val 2s-6d the goods of William Matthews. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 and found Not Guilty nor did fly.

No30 - 10th June 1768 - For stealing one Pair of Childs worsted stockings val 1d the goods of John Darke. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 and found Not Guilty nor did fly.

No121/31 - The wife of John Marshall of Luppitt Labourer - 16th April 1768 - For stealing 3 1/2lb wt of Loaf Sugar val 2s, four cakes val 2d, one loaf of bread val 3d, half a Gross of Corks val 10d and one Linnen Bag val 1d the goods of Mary Hawker widow. Further charged with stealing 1/2lb of Butter val 2d, 1yard and a half of Dowlas val 1s, and one white Holland Handkerchief val 3d the goods of William Searle. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 and found Guilty val 10d. To be whipped and discharged.
No33 - 1st May 1768 - For deserting his Wife and two Children. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 and found Guilty. To be Whipped and Discharged on submission.

No137/34 - 1st September 9 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Hardy, esq. Traversed Michaelmas 1769. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1769. Tried Easter 1770 and found Guilty. Fined 20s, Imprisoned 3 months in Bridewell and until he finds security for his good behaviour for two years himself in £20 and two sufficient sureties in £10 each.

No329/35 - 10th July 9 George 3 - For a nuisance by keeping a wild Bull upon Combepyne common and suffering him to go at large. Traversed Easter 1770. Bill to be found at Xmas 1770. Tried Midsummer 1770 and fined 6d.

person: William Rule of Honiton Tallow Chandler
crime: No36 - 23rd August 10 George 3 - For assaulting Mary Flashman. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1770. Tried Michaelmas 1770 and fined 1s-0d.

No37 - 20th November 11 George 3 - For stealing 50lb wt of straw val 6d the goods of Matthew Liddon; 2nd count for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Xmas 1771. Bill to be found at Xmas 1771. Tried at Xmas 1771 nor did fly.
No38 - 1st May 10 George 3 - For deserting his Wife and Two Children. Bill to be found at Easter 1771. Tried at Easter 1771 and Imprisoned in Bridewell and kept to hard labour for one month.

No39 - 1st November 9 George 3 - For deserting his Wife and Three children to the Damage of the parish of £53-6s-0d. Bill to be found at Easter 1771. Tried at Easter 1771 and Imprisoned in Bridewell and kept to hard labour for Twelve months.

14th May 11 George 3 - For stealing 1400 ffaggotts of wood ffurze the goods of Tristram Collins. Traversed Xmas 1772. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1771. Tried at Xmas 1772 and found Severally Not Guilty nor did Fly.

No47 - 12 April 1770 11 George 3 - For stealing one Iron Hammer val 6d and divers other Goods of Alexander Rice. Traversed Midsummer 1771. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Daniel Brocke junr of Honiton P.Constable
crime: No362/48 - 18 April 11 George 3 - For Neglecting and Refusing to execute and return a summons granted by Benedictus Marwood Tucker, esq, one of His Majestys Justices of the Peace of this County. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1771. Tried at Michaelmas 1771 and fined 1s-0d on submission.

No49 - 7th June 12 George 3 - For unlawfully uttering and paying to Joan Salway a bad Guinea knowing it to be false and counterfeit. Traversed Midsumnmer 1772. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1772. Tried at Midsummer 1772 and found Not Guilty.

person: Samuel Saterday alias Saterley of Upottery Labourer
crime: No379/50 - 1st February 11 George 3 - For running away and leaving his wife and 3 children to the charge of the parish of £10. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1772.

No385/51 - 12 December 13 George 3 - For unjustly and contemptuously Refusing to take upon him the office of Hundred Constable. Bill to be found at Epiphany 1773. Tried at Easter 1773 and fined 3s-4d on submission.

No399/52 - 21st October 12 George 3 - For a nuisance in laying 8 Horse Seams of Stones out in the Kings Common Highway there. Bill to be found at Easter 1773. Tried at Midsummer 1773 and fined 1s-0d on submission.

No53 - 15th February 14 George 3 - For stealing 11lb wt of Iron val 1s-4d the goods of SarahPursey widow. Traversed at Easter 1774. Bill to found at Easter 1774. Tried at Easter 774 and found Not Guilty nor did fly.

No181/54 - 21st February 14 George 3 - For Felony stealing one Iron Cheek val 1s-6d and one Iron Stay of a Chaire Spring of 3lb wt and val 2d the goods of George Burrow. Traversed Midsummer 1775. Bill to be found at Easter 1774. Tried Midsummer 1775 and found Not Guilty nor did fly. Also charged for unlawfully and unjustly buying and receiving great quantities of Iron viz; 50 Iron Plates, 100 Iron Horse Shoes, 30 Iron Shovels, 30 Iron Coulters, 10 Iron Plough Shares, and divers other particulars the goods of persons unknown, knowing the same to have been unlawfully come by. 2nd count for unlawfully buying in clandestine manner from persons unknown the like goods con. form. stat. 3rd count for unlawfully buying and receiving of Thomas Parker of Honiton Labourer, great quantities of Iron viz; 5 Iron Plates, 5 Iron Bars, 10 Iron Hore Shoes, 7 Iron Rings, the goods of Sarah Pursey, knowing the same to have unlawfully come by con.form.stat. 4lot, for the like Goods but without the property being ascertained. Traversed Midsummer 1775 Bill to be found at Easter 1774. Tried at Michaelmas 1775 and found Not Guilty.

No57 - 9th July 14 George 3 - For assaulting Mary Glendenning. Traversed Midsummer 1774. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1774. Tried at Midsummer 1774 and found Guilty. Imprisoned for 6 months in Bridewell and untill he pays a ffine of 3s-4d.

No57 - 9th July 14 George 3 - For assaulting Isabella Glendenning. Traversed Midsummer 1774. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1774. Tried at Midsummer 1774 and found Guilty. Imprisoned for 6 months in Bridewell and untill he pays a ffine of 3s-4d.
No435/58 - 22nd May 14 George 3 - For Assaulting John Deane. Traversed at Easter 1775. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1774.

No60 - 5th September 14 George 3 - For stealing 3 Pair of Worsted stockings the goods of Francis King. Traversed Michaelmas 1774. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1774. Tried Michaelmas 1774 and found Guilty val 10d - to be whipped and discharged.

person: Christopher Nanjulean of Honiton Officer of Excise
crime: No441/61 - 18th September 14 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon John Check the [younger] - several counts. Bill to found at Epiphany 1775. Removed by Certiorari after Epiphany and before Easter 1775.

No212/62 - 26th April 1775 - For a Contempt fo Court in refusing to be sworn and give Evidence on an Appeal. Traversed Easter 1775. Bill to be found at Easter 1775. Tried Midsummer 1775 and found Not Guilty.
No456/63 - 12 January 15 George 3 - For assaulting Joseph Porter. Bill to be found at Easter 1775. Tried Midsummer 1775 and fined 6d on submission

person: Timothy Baily alias Smith of Honiton Labourer
crime: No473/64 - 1st August 15 George 3 - For assaulting William Raymond. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1775. Tried Midsummer 1776 and fined 1s on submission.

No65 - 15th July 16 George 3 - For assaulting George Irwin. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill to be found at Midsummer 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 and found Guilty - Imprisoned in the Bridewell for three months.

No66 - 14th August 16 George 3 - For Felony stealing one pair of Silver Shoe Buckles the goods of Hugh Akerman. Traversed Michaelmas 1776. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1776. Tried Michaelmas 1776 and found Guilty val 6d - Imprisoned in Bridewell six months; whipped thrice and discharged.
No496 - 15 September 16 George 3 - For asaulting Thomas Deane. Bill to be found at Michaelmas 1776.

No68 - 4th April 17 George 3 - For stealing one Dowlas shirt val 1s ye Goods of Richard Dowdney. Traversed Easter 1777. Bill found Easter 1777. Tried Easter 1777 and found Guilty. Imprisoned in Bridewell one month, whipped twice and discharged.

person: Michael Teape of Honiton Labourer [now of Exeter Glazier]
crime: No69 - 12 Feb 17 George 3 - For assaulting Hannah Teape his wife at Honiton. Traversed Easter 1777. Bill found Easter 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 and found Not Guilty.
No70 - 1st January 16 George 3 - For unlawfully deserting his wife and 2 children and dam £10. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tried Epiphany 1778 and found Not Guilty.

person: Mary Vincent singlewoman daughter of Robert Vincent
crime: No71 - 1st April 18 George 3 - For assaulting Timothy Hoare a Sheriffs Bailiff in the execution of his office and rescuing John Norton Junr out of his custody. 2nd count, Comm Asst vids soms. Traversed Midsummer 1778. Bill found Easter 1778. Tried Michaelmas 1778 and fined 1s-0d on submission.

person: James Tempest Watson alias James Watson of Honiton Gent
crime: No255/74 - 17th November 19 George 3 - For a conspiracy to charge Walter Wright with sodomy. 2nd count, for falsely charging him to commit sodomy with said Hake and thereby getting Wright to give him a notefor 20 Guineas and also 1 and 1/2 Guineas in money under colour of concealing and not prosecute said crime. 3rd count, for threatening said Wright that unless he would give said Hake 20 Guineas or a note for that sum he would swear sodomy against him and thereby obtaining crime. Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Epiphany 1779. Tried Epiphany 1779 and found Guilty. Fined 20 Marks and Imprisoned 6 months in Bridewell.
No553/76 - 20th July 19 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Gatchell there. Bill found Michaelmas 1779. Tried Easter 1780 and fined 1s-0d on submission.
No555/78 - 29th May 19 George 3 - For assaulting Mary Symes [widow]. Traversed Easter 1780. Bill found Michaelmas 1779. Tried Midsummer 1780 and found Guilty - fined 5s.

No79 - 17th December 20 George 3 - For felony stealing 1 piece of Iron being the spring of a Gate val 10d the goods of John Bragg, esq. Traversed Epiphany 1780. Bill found Epiphany 1780. Tried Epiphany 1780 and found Not Guilty [being deemed no Felony].

No565/80 - 2nd April 20 George 3 - For assaulting Charles Harvey [constable of Combepyne] and beating him. 2nd count for an asault. Bill found Easter 1780. Tried Midsummer 1780 and fined 1s-0d on submission.

person: Sarah Palmer w/o Thomas Palmer of Axminster Labourer
crime: No85 - 1st June 20 George 3 - For milking a Cow of John Pyne and stealing 4 quarts of milk val 8d. Bill found Midsummer 1780. Traversed Midsummer 1780. Tried Midsmmer 1780 and found Guilty and sentenced to be Whipped and Birched.
No577/86 - 25th September 20 George 3 - For assaulting John Clarke. Bill found Michaelmas 1780. Tried Epiphany 1781 and fined 1s-0d.
No580/93 - 25th September 20 George 3 - For assaulting Richard Lane. Bill found Michaelmas 1780. Tried Epiphany 1781 and fined 1s-0d.
No268/94 - 25th September 20 George 3 - For assaulting John Maunder. Bill found Michaelmas 1780. Traversed Michaelmas 1780. Tried Epiphany 1781 and fined 1s-0d.
No269/95 - 24th September 20 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Reed the younger. Bill found Michaelmas 1780. Traversed Michaelmas 1780. Tried Epiphany 1781 and fined 1s-0d.
No590/96 - 1st march 21 George 3 - For assaulting Jane [uxs] of Thomas Denner. Bill found Easter 1781. Tried Midsummer 1781 and fined 1s-0d.
No97 - 13th June 21 George 3 - For unlawfully deserting his wife and 4 children ad damages 20s. Bill found Midsummer 1781. Traversed Midsummer 1781. Tried Midsummer 1781 and found Not Guilty.

No284/98 - 7th August 21 George 3 - For assaulting Jane Mace singlewoman with an intent to Ravish and Carnally know. 2nd count, Common Assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tried Epiphany 1781 and found Not Guilty.

No100 - 26th November 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 28lb weight of Obb Yarn val 30s the goods of George Trenchard. 2nd Count the goods of a person unknown. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tried Epiphany 1782 and found Guilty val 11d - Imprisoned in Gaol six months, whipped twice and discharged.

No603/101 - 24th December 22 George 3 - For assaulting John Perry and unlawfully Breaking and Entering a dwelling house then in the possession of the said John Perry and taking and carrying away the Doors and Casements belonging and affixed thereto, and one Dust Bed, one Bed head, and divers other Goods and Chattels val 20s, the property of the said John Perry. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Traversed Easter 1782. Tried Midsummer 1782 and found Not Guilty.

No604/102 - 7th January 22 George 3 - For a Forcible entry into a dwelling House in Honiton in the possession of one John Perry and Expelling and keeping him out of the possession thereof. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Traversed 1782. Tried Midsummer 1782 and found Not Guilty.

No103 - 10th September 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Black Quilted Coat, val 2s, one Cotton Handkerchief val 3d, one Cambrick Handkerchief with a Lace Border val 3s, two Childs Holland Shifts val 6d, three womens Caps val 6d, three pair of Holland Shifts Sleeves val 3d, one pound weight Wool val 1s, Two ounces of Worsted val 2d, and two Blankets val 1s, the goods of Daniel Paddon. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782. Tried Michaelmas 1782 and found Guilty val 4d - Imprisoned Six months in Bridewell.
No104 - 25th June 21 george 3 - For a nuisance. Bill found michaelmas 1782. Traversed Easter 1783. Tried Midsummer 1783 and found Not Guilty.
No105 - 16th October 22 George 3 - For assaulting Robert Honiborn. Bill found Epiphany 1783.
No107 - 18th January 23 George 3 - For assaulting Martin Homyard. Bill found Easter 1783.

No1/71 - 30th April 1764 - For not repairing the road leading from Sticklepath towards Venn in length One mile and half in breadth 8 Feet. Bill Traversed Michaelmas 1766. Bill found Midsummer 1766. Tried Xmas 1767 and found Not Guilty.

No2/209 - 23rd July 1766 - For conspiring the ruin of one William Hocker a Baker thereby preventing all persons residing there and all his Customers from buying Bread of him who were Woolcombers, and for extorting from him 5s under pretence of forgiving him. Bill Traversed Xmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Removed by Certiorari into the Court of Kings Bench.

No16/210 - 23rd 1766 - For Conspiring the ruin of one William Hocker a Baker thereby preventing all persons residing there and following the trade of Serge weaving and all his customers who were Serge weavers from buying bread of him or dealing with him in his trade of a Baker, and for extorting from him 5s under pretences of forgiving him. Bill Traversed Xmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Removed by Certiorari into the Court of Kings Bench.

No29 - 6th July 1768 - For stealing one Plough Share val 7d and one Coulter val 9d the Goods of Thomas Dunn. Bill Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 and found Guilty val 10d. To be Transported for Seven Years.

person: Jacob Clift of Holcomb Rogus Labourer
crime: No30/284 - 30th January 1768 - For defrauding Jeremiah Woodbury of 2s-8d in the Prices charged for Conveying a Vagrant from Holcomb Rogus to Launceston. Bill Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 and Indictment Quashed.

person: George Warren of Holcomb Rogus Blacksmith
crime: No31/323 - 1st July 9 George 3 - For assaulting John Perry. Bill founjd Midsummer 1769. Tried Michaelmas 1769 and fined 6d on submission.

No32/327 - 4th November 10 George 3 - For unlawfully rescuing divers Goods and Chattels of one William Tarr distrained by Samuel and William Foxford for £22 rent due to Agnes Lamb. Bill found Xmas 1770. Tried Easter 1770 and fined 6d on submission.

No33 - 24th January 10 George 3 - For running away and leaving his wife and Child to the charge of the parish of 12s-6d. Bill found Easter 1770. Tried Easter 1770 and to be Imprisoned 1 month in Bridewell and whipped there twice.

No34/339 - 11th December 10 George 3 - For forcibly breaking and entering a Meadow there and unlawfully taking and loading and driving away a Bay Gelding of the price of £4 the property of Grace Atten [widow]. Bill Traversed Midsummer 1770. Bill found Easter 1770. Tried Michaelmas 1770 and fined 1s-0d on submission.

person: Bartholomew Hurley of Holcomb Rogus Yeoman
crime: No35/369 - 23rd December 12 George 3 - For unlawfully permitting Ann Maunder to escape and go at large whom he had in his Custody by virtue of warrant under the hands and seals of two Justices of the Peace for the County of Somerset for a Misdemeanor. Bill Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tried Easter 1773 and found Not Guilty.

No36 - 2nd June 12 George 3 - For unlawfully carrying and leaving her Female Bastard in that parish which had been born in St. Thomas the Apostle ad dam forum 40s. Bill found Midsummer 1772. Tried Midsummer 1772 and to be Imprisoned 3 months in Bridewell and fined 1d on submission.

No37 - 1st January 12 George 3 - For unlawfully running away and deserting his Child and leaving it to the charge of the Parish of 40s. Bill found Michaelmas 1772. Tried Michaelmas 1772 to be imprisoned 3 months in Bridwell and whipped the first Monday in every month.
No38/390 - 1st September 12 George 3 - For not returning a list of Jurors. Bill Traversed Midsummer 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Michaelmas 1773 and fined 3s-4d.

person: Nichokas Cleake of Holcomb Rogus Labourer
crime: No39 - 27th June 13 George 3 - For stealing one Holland shirt val 5s the goods of John Alford. Bill Traversed Midsummer 1773. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tried Midsummer 1773 Guilty val 10d Transported for Seven years.

person: John Allen of Holcomb Rogus Cooper
crime: No40/404 - 23rd December 12 George 3 - For unlawfully, wilfully, and contempuously refusing and neglecting to aid and assist Bartholomew Hurley Tythingman of that parish to take care of Ann Maunder whom he had in his Custody by a Justices Warrant, whereby she escaped. Bill Traversed Michaelms 1773. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tried Michaelmas 1773 and fined 1s-0d on submission. John Allen found Not Guilty.

No43 - 4th October 13 George 3 - For feloniously stealing half a peck of wheat val 10d, half a peck of wheaten meal val 8d, Five pounds weight of beef Suet val 1s-6d and divers other goods of Lodawick Burnell. There were 3 other Indictments for Felonies against this prisoner but being transported on the 1st was ordered not to be tryed on the others. Bill Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Epiphany 1774 and found Guilty val 8d Transported for Seven Years.

No44/198 - 26th September 14 George 3 - For assauolting David Hitchcock with a Gun with an intent to Murder him. 2nd Count for a common assault. Bill Traversed Michaelmas 1774. Bill found Michaelmas 1774. Tried Epiphany 1775 - Not Guilty.

No45 - 21st June 15 George 3 - For stealing one Dowlas sheet val 5s the goods of Mary Manley widow. Bill Traversed Midsummer 1775. Bill found Midsummer 1775. Tried Midsummer 1775 - Not Guilty - nor did fly.
No46/204 - 9th October 15 George 3 - For assaulting Elizabeth the wife of Thomas Dunn. Bill Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Easter 1776 - Not Guilty.

No47/477 - 23rd December 16 George 3 - For assaulting David Hitchcock and unjustly rescuing Nicholas Webber whom he had arrested and had in his custody by virtue of a warrant from the Sheriff of Devon. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Easter 1776 and fined 1d each.
No51/477 - For unlawfully rescuing himself and escaping out of the custody of said David Hitchcock against his will. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Epiphany Easter 1776 and fined 1d.

No52/484 - 26th June 16 George 3 - For assaulting William Snelling and Jerman two Sheriffs Officers and unjustly rescuing James yeo, esq, whom they had arrested. Bill Traversed Michaelmas 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Tried Epiphany 1777, and found Not Guilty.

No55/500 - 29th November 17 George 3 - For wickedly Destroying a wear belonging to Shillingford Mill there whereby the water was diverted and for forcibly and unlawfully taking away a pollard Ash part of the said wear belonging to one John Harris. Bill Traversed Easter 1777. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 and found Not Guilty.

No56/512 - 22nd December 14 George 3 - For unlawfully deserting his wife and 3 children ad dim £16-10s-0d. Bill Traversed Michaelmas 1777. Bill found Midsummer 1777. Tried Michaelmas 1777 anf fined 1s-0d on submission.

No57/522 - 1st September 17 George 3 - For not returning a list of Jurors being Tythingman of Burlescombe Town Tything. Bill Traversed Easter 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tried Midsummer 1778 and fined 1s-0d on submission.
No58/242 - 4th April 18 George 3 - For assaulting John Perham at Honiton. Bill Traversed Midsummer 1778. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tried Michaelmas 1778 and found Not Guilty.
No59 - 2nd October 18 George 3 - For stealing 5 Iron Horse Shoes val 20d ye goods of a James Rowe. Bill Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Epiphany 1779. Tried Epiphany 1779 Not Guilty nor did fly.

No60/546 - 16th May 19 George 3 - For assalting Abraham Moxey in the execution of his office of Sheriffs Bailiff. 2nd Count, Common Assault. Bill found Midsummer 1779. Tried Michaelmas 1779 all fined 1d.

No66 - 1st February 21 George 3 - For unlawfully deserting her Female Bastard Child and leaving it to be maintained by the parish whereby they expended the sum of £1-4s-0d in the doing thereof. Bill Traversed Easter 1781. Bill found Easter 1781. Tried Easter 1781 and found Guilty. Imrisoned two months in Bridewell and whipped once.
No67/600 - 18th August 21 George 3 - For assaulting Richard Norrish. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Tried Epiphany 1782 and fined 1s-0d on submission.

No70 - 14th November 22 George 3 - For deserting his Child and leaving him to be maintained by the said parish of Uffculme whereby they have expended the sum of 40s in doing thereof. Bill found Epiphany 1782.
No71/269 - 5th January 22 George 3 - For assaulting John Locke. Bill Traversed Easter 1782. Bill found Epiphany 1782.
No71/270 - 5th January 22 George 3 - For assaulting William Locke. Bill Traversed Easter 1782. Bill found Epiphany 1782.
No77 - 8th January 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Hackney Saddle val 8s the goods of James Matthews.

No78 - 31st December 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing two Bushels of unwinnowed Barley val 6d the goods of Richard Boobyer. Bill Traversed Epiphany 1783. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Tried Epiphany 1783 - Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned 1 Hour having Inlisted.

No50/1 - 20th January 1754 - For unlawfully riding away one Nagg val £5 the property of Robert Basleigh. Bill found Midsummer 1754. Comment - [Midsummer 1754 Transported for 7 Years for another fact].

No36/2 - 01 January 1751 - For imbezling and disposing of 3 worsted Chains and 27lb weight of Abb Yarn val £3 the goods of Charles Sweet left with Defendant to be made into Serge [cret]. Bill found Michaelmas 1752. Comment - Ran away long ago.

No47/3 - 14th February 1754 - For unlawfully taking and carrying away one [horse] Seam of faggot wood val 1s and 30 [horse] seams of of hardwood and Billetts Val 10s the goods of Thomas Squire. Bill found Easter 1754.
No4 - Presented by the Grand Jury for running away and leaving his family a Charge to the Parish of Hatherleigh. Bill found Midsummer 1756.
No5 - Presented by Grand Jury for not taking Care of their Familys. Bill found Easter 1759.
No108/8 - 22nd December 1762 - For breaking down a Gate in the highway leading to Hatherleigh Moor. Bill found Xmas 1763.
No111/9 - 16th February 1763 - For bringing and conveying into and leaving a Bastard Child born of Joan Knight in the parish of Bradford and burthening the Parish therewith. Bill found Easter 1763.

No170/10 - 26th March 1766 - For a forcible entry into a Messuage and Tenement called Upcott in Hatherleigh in the possession of Frances Easterbrook widow and Expelling and keeping her out of the possession thereof. Bill Traversed Midsummer 1766. Bill found Easter 1766. Tried Michaelmas 1766 and found Guilty and fined sixpence.
No172/11 - 25th March 1766 - For assaulting Sarah the wife of John Wade. Traversed Easter 1767. Bill found Easter 1766. Tried Midsummer 1767 and found Not Guilty.
No234/12 - 1st November 1766 - For deserting his Wife and 3 children and leaving them to the Charge of the Parish of Hatherleigh who expended £1-5s-0d therein. Bill found Easter 1767.

No13 - 11th August 1767. For forcible entry into a Dwelling house with the appurtenances called Upcott in Hatherleigh in the possession of Frances Easterbrooke widow and Expelling and keeping her out of the Possession thereof. Traversed Michaelmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 and found Guilty - Imprisoned for 3 months and untill he pays a fine of £10 and gives Security for his good behaviour for 3 years. Himself in £50 and two securities in £25 each.

crime: No279/15 - 20th November 1767 - For assaulting William Hockin Junior at Shebbear. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tried Easter 1768 and fined 6d.

No18 - 7th May 1768 - For assaulting James Friend at Oakhampton. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 and found Guilty and fined 6d.

person: John Facey of Werrington late Overseer of the Poor
crime: No294/19 - 18th July 1768 - For unlawfully and contemptuously neglecting and refusing to pay certain sums of money as by an order of this court he was commanded to do. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Midsummer 1769 and fined 6d.

crime: No130/23 - 5th January 1769 - For assaulting John Lewis. Traversed Easter 1769. Bill found Easter 1769. Tried Midsummer 1769 and found Not Guilty.

crime: No358/33 - 26th March 11 George 3 - For a forcible entry into a Dwelling House in Blacktorrington in the possession of John Jory and expelling him. Bill found Easter 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 and fined 1s [except] Mary Evans who was fined 6d.

crime: No179/40 - 1st 12 George 3 - For assaulting William Allen constable of that parish in the Execution of his office and unlawfully rescuing hilip Courtice whom he had in his custody by a Justices Warrant for Bastardy. 2nd Count for a common Assault. crime: No381/42 - 14th May 11 George 3 - For unlawfully Imbezzling 18lb weight of Obb Wool of Thomas Puddicombe. Traversed Easter 1773. Bill found Michaelmas 1772. Tried Easter 1773 and found Not Guilty.

crime: No476/53 - 17th December 16 George 3 - Disobeying an order in Bastardy made by Henry Stevens and John Arscott, esq's, for a Female Child born of Emmey Brooke Singlewoman in Winkleigh. Bill found Easter 1776.

crime: No227/54 - 1st June 16 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Chine of pork val 1s-6d, 2lb weight of Bacon val 1s, 2lb weight of Hoggs Lard val 1s, and divers other goods of William Jeffery. crime: No57 - 2nd December 17 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one pair of womans leather shoes val 2s-6d the goods of George Bond. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Tried Epiphany 1777 and found Guilty val 10d Imprisoned in Bridewell one Month and whipped.
No574/58 - 1st April 17 George 3 - For embezzling 10lb weight of Obb Wool of john Mardon. Bill found Midsummer 1777. Tried Michaelmas 1777 and fined 6d.

crime: No59 - 18 George 3 - For unlawfully cheating and defrauding William Whitborne Darke of 2s-9d by concealing 4 stones of the weight of 3lb in a Pad of Yarn which she sold him. No532/61 - 13th July 18 George 3 - For a Riot with others and assaulting William Downe. 2nd Count Common Assault. Traversed Midsummer 1779. Bill found Midsummer 1778.

person: Mary Dymond of North Petherwin Singlewoman
crime: No68 - 20th November 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Whitney Cardinal val 3s, one check apron val 1s, one white handkerchief val 6d, one yard 1/2 of Ribbon val 4d, and two womens Caps val 6d, the goods of Nathaniel Bridgeman. No69 - 1st November 23 George 3 - For unlawfully deserting his Child ad dam £1-10s-0d. Bill found Easter 1783.

No18/1 - 4th February 1756 - For stealing one Bushell of Winnowed Barley val 1s, the goods of John Peak. Bill found Easter 1756.

No369/23 - 6th September 11 George 3 - For assaulting Hugh Stephens. Traversed Xmas 1772. Bill found Michaelmas 1771. Tried Easter 1772 and fined 6d.

crime: No566/50 - 8th November 20 George 3 - For assaulting Joan the wife of John May. Traversed Easter 1780. Bill found Midsummer 1780. Tried Michaelmas 1780 - found Guilty and fined 1s each.

crime: No567/52 - 25th November 20 George 3 - For unlawfully escaping out of Bridewell being charged in Bastardy. Traversed Easter 1780.

No26 - 9th May 12 George 3 - For stealing 2 Bushels Barley val 6s the goods of Jacob Rady. 2nd count for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Midsummer 1772. Bill found Midsummer 1772. Tried Midsummer 1772 - Not guilty nor did fly.

No29 - 27th march 13 George 3 - For stealing 5lb weight of Beef val 1s-3d ye goods of Thomas Poole. Traversed Easter 1773. Bill found Easter 1773. Tried Easter 1773 - Guilty val 4d - whipped and discharged.

No398/30 - 23rd February 13 George 3 - For a forcible entry into a Cottage or Dwelling House and Garden called Woodbridge Garden in Farway and ejecting William Gifford therefrom. Bill found Easter 1773. Tried Epiphany 1774 and all found Not guilty.

No180/34 - 20th May 13 George 3 - For assaulting Ann Oldridge and unlawfully breaking and entering her dwelling house. Traversed Midsummer 1773. Bill foundMidsummer 1773. Tried Michaelmas 1773 - both fined 1s-0d on submission.

No36 - 1st August 13 George 3 - For assaulting William Searle. Traversed Michaelmas 1773. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tried Michaelmas 1773 - Guilty - Imprisoned in Bridewell for 3 months and untill he finds security for his good behaviour for 12 months after.

No37 - 30th September 13 George 3 - For stealing 15 feet of two inch Elms Plank val 3s the goods of Sir John Poole Bart. Traversed michaelmas 1773. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tried Michaelmas 1773 Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned two months in Bridewell and whipped twice.
No183/38 - 7th December 14 George 3 - For assaulting Elizabeth Quenten widow. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Easter 1774 - Guilty - fined 3s-4d.

person: Sarah Newton w/o James Newton of Shute Labourer
crime: No445/39 - 11th October 14 George 3 - For unlawfully conveying a Female Bastard Child into the parish of Sidmouth and leaving it at the Stable Door of William Carslake. Bill found Epiphany 1775. Tried Easter 1777 - fined 1d on submission.

person: William Smith junior of Widworthy Baker
crime: No466/40 - 25th April 15 George 3 - For assaulting John Parham at Widworthy. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1775. Tried Easter 1776 and both found Not Guilty.
No473/42 - 1st August 15 George 3 - For assaulting William Raymond. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tried Midsummer 1776 - all Guilty and fined 1s.

No46 - 11th July 15 George 3 - For milking John Uphams cows and feloniously stealing 3 quarts of milk val 4d. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Epihany 1776. Tried Epiphany 1776 - Guilty and Imprisoned Six months in Bridewell and whipped thrice.

No47 - 10th August 10 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 16 sheaves of Reed val 4s the goods of James Michell, clerk. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - all Not Guilty nor did fly.
No228/50 - 20th August 16 George 3 - For stealing 4 Acres of wheat val £14 ye goods of William Starr. Bill found Michaelmas 1776.

No237/54 - 9th April 15 George 3 - For unlawfully receiving Mary Clarke an Inmate into his Cottage where she was delivered of a Bastard Child whereof he was the father. Traversed Easter 1777. Bill found Easter 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 and fined 1s on submission.

person: Henry Clarke junior of Colyton Labourer
crime: No55 - 7th June 17 George 3 - For feloniously stealing a [Guinea] in Gold, a HalfCrown and 5s in silver the goods and monies of Henry Clarke senior. Traversed Midsummer 1777. Bill found Midsummer 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 and found Guilty val 10d - Whipped and discharged.

No56 - 7th June 17 George 3 - For feloniously receiving one half-crown [part cell] of the above monies knowing it to be stolen. Traversed Midsummer 1777. Bill found Midsummer 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 - Guilty but discharged as the prisoner was convicted of only Petty Larceny. comment: He should not to have been tryed at all.
No57 - 4th August 17 George 3 - For unlawfully deserting his wife ad dimm £3-15s-11d. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tried Epiphany 1778 - Not Guilty.

person: The Reverend Richard Priest of Southleigh Clerk
crime: No528/58 - 20th February 18 George 3 - For unlawfully refusing to provide for Mary Blackmore his Parish Apprentice - ad dmn Paroch £1-7s-0d. Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Easter 1778. Tried Easter 1779 - Not Guilty.

No59 - 5th June 18 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 10 yards of Blanketing val 10s ye goods of James Quick junior. Traversed Midsummer 1778. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tried Midsummer 1778 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: John Good of Beer and Seaton Mariner
crime: No61 - 18th January 20 George 3 - For assaulting Sarah Small widow. Traversed Easter 1780. Bill found Easter 1780. Tried Midsummer 1780 - Not Guilty.

No62 - 25th June 20 George 3 - For asaulting Robert Gray Governor of the Workhouse. Traversed Midsummer 1780. Bill found Midsummer 1780. Tried Midsummer 1780 - Guiltu and Imprisoned 3 months in Bridewell and whipped twice.

No63 - 16th October 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Duck val 6d the goods of William Anning. 2nd Count the goods of a person unknown. [Also charged] For feloniously stealing two Ducks val 1s and one Drake val 6d the goods of Richard Blake, clerk. 2nd Count the goods of a person unknown. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tried Eiphany 1782 - Guilty on both charges val 10d - Imprisoned three months in Bridewell, whipped once and discharged.
No65 - 13th April 22 George 3 - For assaulting Henry Manning his parish apprentice. Bill found Midsummer 1782. Tried Midsummer 1782 and fined 1s.

No66 - 8th May 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing two Iron Horse Shoes val 1d and 7lb weight of old Iron val 7d the goods of Sir John William Pole Bart. Traversed Midsummer 1783. Bill found Midsummer 1783. Tried Midsummer 1783 - Guilty val 9d - whipped and discharged.

person: Henry Lavers of Totness Parish Constable
crime: No1 - Presented by Richard Browne H.Constable for not returning Lists of Jurors. Bill found Michaelmas 1750.

person: Philip Faul alias Trole of Townstal Parish Constable Dartmouth
crime: No4 - Presented by Lewis Oldreive for not returning Lists of Jurors. Bill found Michaelmas 1751.

person: Abraham Choak of Totnes Parish Constable
crime: No6 - Presented by said Lewis Oldreive for the like offence. Bill found Michaelmas 1751.

No167/7 - 10th December 1755 - For not repairing part of a Common Highway leading from the village of Ashprington towards the town of Plymouth called Guerston Lane from Redding Pitts nigh Bowden Gate to Guerston alias Garston Cross in the parish of Totness in length 35 perch and in breadth 8 feet [and that they as being Tenants and Occupiers of the Lands adjoining ought to repair the same]. Bill found Easter 1766. Tried Michaelmas 1766 and Quashed.
No93/10 - 4th July 1767 - For assaulting Andrew Crispin. Traversed Midsummer 1767. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 - Not Guilty.

No11 - 17th August 1767 - For stealing one Looking Glass val 2s and one Guinea in Gold the goods and monies of john Chester. Traversed Michaelmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No 12 - Sayers - For a Misdemeanor. Traversed Michaelmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1767 and removed by Certiorari into His Majesty's Court of the Kings Bench.

No13 - 20th March 1768 - For stealing one Breast of Mutton val 10d the goods of William Polyblank. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Easter 17val 10s the goods of 68 - Guilty - whipped and discharged.

No14 - 30th May 1768 - For stealing two young Cocks val 10s the goods of John Wills, esq. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 - Guilty val 1s-6d - To be Transported for Seven Years. Also charged 27th May 1768 fo stealing seven Ducks val 5s the goods of John Chaffe, and 30th May 1768 for stealing one young Grey Cock val 5s the goods of Allen Searle. comment: Not tryed on the last two charges being transported on the first indictment.

No289/17 - 7th April 1768 - For carrying Grace Rowse Singlewoman then big with child into the parish of Dittisham without any lawful warrant. Traversed Easter 1769. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1769 - Not Guilty.

person: Roger Jervis of East Pottlemouth Labourer
crime: No119/18 - 4th August 1768 - For violently and unlawfully making a Hole through the wall of an outhouse belonging to one John Lamble there situate. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 - Indictment Quashed. Also charged with assaulting Elizabeth the wife of John Lamble but found Not Guilty.

No301/20 - 21st December 1768 - For unlawfully breaking the Manor Pound of Dodbrooke and setting at large and driving 3 pigs of his impounded by Nicholas Head. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Midsummer 1769 and each fined 6d by submission.

No22 - 20th March 10 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 6 Guineas 5 half guineas and one 6s-9d piece the goods and monies of Samuel Soper. Traversed Midsummer 1770. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tried Midsummer 1770 - Tope Not Guilty nor did fly - Nicholson Guilty val 6d Transported for 7 Years on this and another conviction.

No24 - 1st April 10 George 3 - For stealing one Peck of Barley val 1s ye goods of John Soper. Traversed Midsummer 1770. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tried Midsummer 1770 - Guilty val 5d and transported as above.

No25 - 26th September 10 George 3 - For stealing 12lb weight of Soap val 5s, one Diaper Knapkin val 1s, 2lb weight of powder sugar val val 1s, 1lb weight of Sun Raisons val 6d, 20 foot of Deal val 5s, and 6lb weight of Lead val 1s, the goods of Philemon Pownell, esq. Traversed Michaelmas 1770. Bill found Michaelmas 1770. Tried Michaelmas 1770 - Guilty val 10d - Transported for Seven Years.

person: Arthur French junior of Dartmouth Mariner
crime: No26 - 13th February 11 George 3 - For assaulting Arthur Kemp at the Harbour of St.Ives. 3 Counts. Bill found Midsummer 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 and fined 1s on submission.

No27 - 9th July 7 George 3 - For unlawfully leaving his wife and two Children to the charge of the parish of Dittisham of £50. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Epiphany 1773 - to be whipped and Imprisoned one Month.

No28 - 26th November 14 George 3 - For stealing 6lb weight of worsted val 6s and divers other woollen goods of Solomon Peeke. 2nd Count for ye goods of a person unknown. Traversed Easter 1774. Bill found Easter 1774. Tried Easter 1774 - Guilty val 20s - Transported for Seven years.

No29 - 19th August 15 George 3 - For stealing two fat Geese val 2s the goods of John Snell. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1775 - Guilty - Imprisoned 3 months in Bridewell and whipped twice.

No30 - 1st January 16 George 3 - For stealing a Light Drab Cloth Coat and waistcoat and divers other goods of Walter Venning. Further charged for stealing 14 handkerchiefs and divers other goods of of Thomas Jewell. 2nd Count of persons ignorant. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Epiphany 1776 - Not guilty nor did fly on both charges - no evidence appeared as prisoner agreed to Inlist for a soldier.

No478/31 - 2nd November 16 George 3 - For assaulting William Trebilcock and falsely Imprisoning him for one hour and for unlawfully extorting from him 8s-7d. 2nd Count, for an assaulting, false Imprisonment and Extorting 8s-7d under colour of not sending him to Bridewell. Traversed Easter 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - Guilty - Parnell fined 10 Marks and Imprisoned seven days in Bridewell; Trist fined 40 Marks and Imprisoned Fourteen days in Bridewell.

No492/33 - 22nd August 16 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon George Norman, [Constable]. 2nd Count for a Common Assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tried Epiphany 1777 - fined 3s-4d on submission.

person: Grace Full of West Cornworthy Widow
crime: No34 - 31st May 18 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Silver cup one Silver table spoon one Silver Pap spoon and two Silver Teaspoons the goods of Thomas Lock. Traversed Midsummer 1778. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tried Midsummer 1778 - Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned six months in Bridewell, kept to hard Labour whipped thrice and discharged.

No35 - 17th August 18 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Black Silk Cloak of Elizabeth Luscombe Spinster. Traversed Michelmas 1778. Bill found Michaelmas 1778. Tried Michaelmas 1778 - Guilty val 8d - Imprisoned one month in Bridewell and whipped once.

No36 - 26th May 20 George 3 - For feloniously stealing on Hen Turkey the goods of James Codd. 2nd Count. Traversed Midsummer 1780. Bill found Midsummer 1780. Tried Midsummer 1780 - Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned one month in Bridewell and whipped twice.

No37 - 29th April 20 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 5 Bridles, 3 Stirrup Irons and 3 Girths the goods of Richard Trist. Traversed Midsummer 1780. Bill found Midsummer 1780. Tried Midsummer 1780 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No586/38 - 13th December 21 George 3 - For assaulting William Abrahams.

No39 - 8th February 22 George 3 - For asaulting John Drewe with an Intent to feloniously to kill and murder. 2nd Count, Common Assault. Bill found Easter 1782. Tried 1782 - Guilty - Fined 5 Marks and Imprisoned 3 months in Bridewell.

No40 - 31st May 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Iron Shovell val 1s the goods of John Pepperell. Traversed Midsummer 1783. Bill found Midsummer 1783. Tried Midsummer 1783 - Guilty val 4d - whipped and discharged.
No1 - Presented at Mid[summer] 1746 by William Beddick. H.Constable for running from his Family and leaving them to the charge of the parish.

person: Richard Crabb junior of Woodberry Labourer
crime: No4/2 - 26th September 1747 - For stealing 15s the moneys of John Leat. Bill found Xmas 1747.

crime: No40/3 - 12th January 1753 - For assaulting Charity Sage. Bill found Xmas 1753.

person: Jude Trott uxor Robert Trott of Littleham Mariner
crime: No57/4 - 20th November 1758 - For unlawfully receiving the carcas of a Goose and a Goose's Gibbletts the goods of William Long knowing them to be stolen. Traversed Michaelmas 1766. Bill found Xmas 1759.

No95/5 - 28th February 1760 - For a nuisance by throwing the flesh of a Dead Horse into the River Otter near the Bridge, and leaving it there to the annoyance of the Kings Subjects. Bill found Easter 1760.

person: Thomas Lang of Collaton Rawleigh Labourer
crime: No97/6 - 18th February 1760 - Fpr assaulting John Critchett, esq. Bill found Easter 1760.

person: Ann Lockyer of East Budleigh Singlewoman
crime: No118/8 - 11th July 1763 - For a Riot and Assault upon John Critchett. Bill found Michaelmas 1763.

person: John Sollway junior of Gittisham Labourer
crime: No59/9 - 1st January 1765 - For unlawfully breaking down a Bank or Mound erected across a Lane whereby the waters have overflowed the same in the parish of Gittisham. Traversed Easter 1766. Bill found Xmas 1765. Tried Midsummer 1766 - fined 6d on submission.
No10/10 - 9th March 1752 - For unlawfully taking and carrying away four young Apple Trees val 4s the property of george Salter. Traversed Midsummer 1752. Bill found Midsummer 1752.
No81/11 - 1st January 1767 - For stealing 5 Pecks of Turnips val 6d and 5 Clefts of Hardwood val 3d the goods of Matthew Heathfield. Bill found Xmas 1767.

person: William Goldsworthy of Clist St George Butcher
crime: No218/12 - 1st October 1766 - For assaulting James Marks junior and cutting the wrist of his Left Arm with a knife. Traversed Easter 1767. Bill found Xmas 1767. Tried Midsummer 1767 - Not Guilty.
No13 - 7th July 1768 - For a Felony. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Pleads Misnomer that his name is William Redwood.
No14 - 7th July 1768 - For stealing one shovel value 2s ye goods of John Hellier. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 - Guilty val 10d - Whipped and Discharged.

No293/15 - 17th June 1768 - For voluntarily and maliciously throwing a lighted Candle upon the Top of a thatched Dwellinghouse there belonging to Samuel Follett at one o'clock in the night with intent feloniously to set fire to burn and consume the same to the nuisance of the neighbourhood. 2nd Count, and 3rd, with being laid feloniously and 3rd count without laying it as a nuisance. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 - fined 6d on submission.

person: William Aplin of East Budleigh Miller
crime: No16 - 22nd October 1768 - For stealing 3 Bushells of unwinnowed Wheat val 15s the goods of Mary Potbury widow. 2nd Count for ye goods of a person unknown. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Xmas 1769 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Elizabeth Challice of Woodbury w/o Nicholas Challice Labourer
crime: No299/17 - 6th January 1769 - For injuriouslyand unlawfully Carrying laying and leaving a Male Child born of Elizabeth Davy in the parish of Woodbury into the dwelling house of Thomas Salter Churchwarden of Heavitree with an inten to burthen that parish. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Easter 1769 - fined £3-3s-0d on submission.

person: William Moore of Clist St Mary Mason
crime: No19 - 14th May 9 George 3 - For running away and leaving his wife big with child and one child under 4 years old to the charge of Clist St Mary £2-2s-9d. Bill found Midsummer 1769. Tried Midsummer 1769 - Whipped and Imprisoned one week.

No20 - 10th May 9 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 6 Quarts of Milk the goods of John Duke, esq, val 6d milked from a cow belonging to the said John Duke. Traversed Midsummer 1769. Bill found Midsummer 1769. Tried Midsummer 1769 - Guilty Imprisoned 14 days in Bridewell.

No318/21 - 6th January 9 George 3 - For unlawfully persuading Nicholas Challice and Elizabeth his wife to carry John Davy a Child of 8 months old from Woodbury to Heavitree with one intent to burthen the parish of Heavitree with its maintenances. Traversed Easter 1770. Bill found Midsummer 1769. Tried Midsummer 1770 - Not Guilty.

No22 - 25th December 10 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one pair of Mans Leather Pumps val 2s-6d and one pair of Silver plated Shoebuckles val 2s the goods of Thomas Woodcock. Traversed Xmas 1770. Bill found Xmas 1770. Tried Xmas 1770 - Guilty val 2d - Whipped and Discharged.
No23 - 30th June 10 George 3 - For unlawfully stealing one Scythe val 6d of John Granger. Traversed Midsummer 1770. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tried Midsummer 1770 - Guilty Whipped and Discharged.
No355/24 - 31st August 10 George 3 - For assaulting Agnes ye wife of Richard Chowns. Traversed Xmas 1771. Bill found Michaelmas 1770. Tried Easter 1771 - Guilty fined 6s-8d on submission.

person: Edward Lee of Clist Honiton Butcher
crime: No356/25 - 8th April 11 George 3 - For unlawfully stopping up one of the Arches of a certain Ancient Bridge called Bishops Clist Bridge with Stakes, Stones, etc, whereby, etc. Bill found Easter 1771. Tried Michaelmas 1771 - fined 1s-0d on submission.

No 359/26 - 4th April 11 George 3 - For a forcible entry into two Meadows, an Orchard, and Garden in the parish of Holcombe Rogus and expelling Bartholomew Hurley therefrom. Bill found Easter 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 - fined 6d on submission.
No360/27 - 4th April 11 George 3 - For assaulting Bartholomew Hurley. Bill found Easter 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 - fined 6d on submission.
No28 - 21st April 8 George 3 - For stealing 3 Iron Dragg Tangs val 2s the goods of Ephraim Carter. Traversed Midsummer 1771. Bill found Midsummer 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

crime: No30 - 4th May 11 George 3 - For stealing 2lb Lump Sugar val 1s-4d, 10oz White Thread val 4d, 1/2lb Soap val 3d, 1/2 Yard White Linnen cloth val 3d, 1/2 yard Check Cloth val 5d, ye goods of Rebecca Collier. person: John Charmon of East Budleigh Labourer
crime: No32 - 1st April 12 George 3 - For stealing one Towling Piece val 18s the goods of James Daniells. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tried Easter 1772 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No409/33 - 14th February 13 George 3 - For assaulting Susanna Southcott with an Intent to ravish her. 2nd Count for a common assault. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tried Easter 1775 - Fined 1s on submission.

No419/24 - 24th December 14 George 3 - For unlawfully Breaking up and Destroying a certain covered Gutter over an Ancient Water Course in Mary Lane, there. Traversed Easter 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Midsummer 1774 - Quashed.
No429/35 - 23rd March 14 George 3 - For assaulting Sarah Hoopard. Bill found Easter 1774. Tried Epiphany 1776 - fined 6d on submission.

person: James Daniels of East Budleigh Blacksmith
crime: No446/36 - 3rd January 15 George 3 - For assaulting Joseph Chown. Bill found Epiphany 1775. Tried Midsummer 1775 - fined 1d on submission.

crime: No458/37 - 18th April 15 George 3 - For assaulting James Channon. Bill found Easter 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1775 - each fined 6d on submission.

No40 - 1st July 15 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one pair of blue worsted stockings val 10d the goods of Charles Chown. Traversed Midsummer 1775. Bill found Midsummer 1775. Tried Midsummer 1775 - Guilty Imprisoned six weeks in Bridewell, Whipped and Discharged.
No41 - 26th October 16 George 3 - For stealing two Gallons of Cyder val 1s the goods of John Richards. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Epiphany 1776 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: John Yeates of East Budleigh Gentleman
crime: No483/42 - 23rd October 15 George 3 - For assaulting Hannah the wife of Sampson Lugg. Traversed Easter 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - fined 1s on submission.

person: Hannah Lugg w/o Sampson Lugg of East Budleigh Mariner
crime: No484/43 - 23rd October 15 George 3 - For assaulting John Yeates. Traversed Easter 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - fined 1s on submission.

person: Elias Tarr of Colyton Rawleigh Labourer
crime: No44 - 25th September 16 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 1 Hemp Bag ye goods of James Trooke. Also charged for feloniously stealing 1 Hemp Bag val 1s-6d the goods of Robert Way. Traversed Michaelmas 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tried Michaelmas 1776 - [first charge] Guilty val 4d - Imprisoned in Bridewell three months, whipped and discharged. [second charge] Not tryed on this being punished on the last indictment.
No235/46 - 31st March 17George 3 - For assaulting John Halls. Traversed Midsummer 1777. Bill found Easter 1777. Tried Epiphany 1778 - fined 6d on submission.

person: Henry Langsford of Exmouth within the parish of Littleham Joyner
crime: No234/47 - 11th March 17 George 3 - For assaulting John Denford junior. Traversed Midsummer 1777. Bill found Easter 1777. Tried Michaelmas 1777 - Guilty fined 1s on submission.

person: Mary Jarman of Withecombe Rawleigh widow
crime: No48 - 3rd October 17 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 3 Quarts of Cyder val 6d the goods of Robert Brice after unlawfully entering his cellar. Traversed Michaelmas 1777. Bill found Michaelmas 1777. Tried Michaelmas 1777 - Guilty Imprisoned 3 months in Bridewell, whipped twice and discharged.
No49 - 3rd April 18 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Stocker. Bill found Easter 1778. Tried Midsummer 1778 - fined 1s on submission.

person: John Yeates of East Budleigh Sergemaker
crime: No50 - 25th May 18 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Eyre, esq, a Justice of the Peace in the Execution of his office and Threatening, Villying, Abusing, and Insulting him, and behaving in a Riotous tumultuous manner. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tried Midsummer 1778 - fined 1s on submission.

person: John Austin of East Budleigh Carpenter
crime: No238/51 - 11th June 18 George 3 - For a Combination and Conspiracy to Rise their Wages. Traversed Michaelmas 1778. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tried Epiphany 1778 - Quashed consent of Provisional Counsel.

person: William Willson of East Budleigh Taylor
crime: No56 - 9th November 19 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Light Broadcloth Coat, and one Dark Broadcloth Coat the goods of Richard Blundell, esq. Traversed Epiphany 1779. No57 - 17th May 19 George 3 - For assaulting James Pearce. Bill found Midsummer 1779. Tried Midsummer 1779 - Fined 10s Imprisoned untill sureties himself in 50£ and two sureties in 25£ each for 12 months.

No558/58 - 14th January 20 George 3 - For disobeying William Chand Carrington warrant whereby he as overseer of Lympstone was ordered to pay the officers of Crediton £4-12s-0d towards the support of Elizabeth Westlake and her Family whose husband belonging to Crediton was a substitute for William Tapley of Lympstone in the 1st Devon Militia. Traversed Easter 1780. Bill found Epiphany 1780. Tried Easter 1780 - Not Guilty.

No571/59 - 6th July 20 George 3 - For disobeying Richard Copplestones, esq, warrant whereby he as overseer of Woodbury was ordered ro pay the officers of Ottery St. Mary such sums as they had expended for the Relief of Thomas Bendings Family, a substitute for William Dagworthy of Woodbury. person: Sarah Warren of East Budleigh Singlewoman
crime: No62 - 25th September 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Red Cloak val 20s, Ten Yards of Canvas val 8s, one Black Silk Handkerchief val 2s, one Lawn Apron val 2s, one Barras Apron val 6d one 1 1/2 yard of woolen cloth val 6d, two Linnen Bolster Cloths val 6d, one coarse Linen Bag val 2d, two yards of Flowered Linen val 3s, one Silk Handkerchief val 2s, one Cotton Handkerchief val 1s, one Muslin Cap val 2d, two yards Ribband val 3d, one Barras Sheet val 2s, and one pair of Black Worsted Stockings val 6d, the goods of Daniel Walling. No280/64 - 15th September 21 George 3 - For assaulting John Sanders. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Tried Epiphany 1782 - Guilty fined 53 and committed till the rising of the court and until etc.

crime: No65 - 22nd March 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing Two Pewter Plates val 10d the goods of John Pike. Bill found Easter 1782. Tried Easter 1782 - Guilty Imprisoned One month in Bridewell and whipped twice.

crime: No66 - 29th May 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one iron Key val 1d, Five Silver Tea Spoons val 1s, two Loaves of Bread val 6d, 1/2lb Butter val 2d, the goods of Elizabeth Hern.
