No67 - 29th May 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing four yards of Thread Lace val 1s, the goods of Elizabeth Hoyles widow. Bill found Midsummer 1782. Tried Midsummer 1782 - Not Tryed being convicted and punished on another Indictment.
No68 - 27th December 23 George 3 - For assaulting Anthony Hollett. Bill found Epiphany 1783.

person: William Gibbs of East Budleigh Labourer
crime: No70 - 13th April 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Dowlas Shirt val 6d, 3 Linnen Aprons val 1s, one pair Cotton Stockings val 6d, two pair Worsted Stockings val 1s, one Cotton Handkerchief val 1s, and one Linnen Pillow Drawer val 1s, the goods of John Barker. [Also charged with] Stealing three Hen Fowls val 1s-6d, one Game Cock val 6d, and 300 of cabbage plants val 1s, the goods of Joseph French. Traversed Easter 1782. Bill found Easter 1783. Tried Easter 1783 - Not Guilty nor did fly [on both counts].

person: Richard Perry of Withycombe Rawleigh Labourer
crime: No72 - 6th April 23 George 3 - For breaking and entering a Cellar and feloniously stealing four Gallons of Cyder the property of William Pomeroy. Traversed Easter 1783. Bill found Easter 1783. Tried Easter 1783 - Guilty val 6d Imprisoned one week in Bridewell and whipped once.

No74 - 2nd June 23 George 3 - For unlawfully and negligently permitting to Escape and go at large [he being then one of the Constables of the said parish of Farringdon] Samuel Edwards who'm he had in his custody by virtue of a warrant from Samuel Eyre and John. B. Cholwich, esq's, two of His Majesty's Justices of the Peace in and for the County of Devon.
No1 - Presented for running from their fmilies and leaving them ti the charge of the parish of Crediton. Bill found Xmas 1745.
Presented by the H. Constable for running from their family's and leaving them to the charge of the parish of Sandford. Bill found Xmas 1745.

person: Sarah Brimming of Crediton w/o Jonathan Brimming of Crediton Sergeweaver
crime: No29/5 - 17th July 1751 - For unlawfully buying and receiving 10lb weight of Obb yarn val 10 Goods of richard Milford knowing them to be stolen. [Also charged] another Bill for the like offence only the goods of Yates Parr. Bill found Midsummer 1751. [comment] Ran away when first indicted. Nb: They are said to be all dead.

person: George Underhill late of Crediton but then residing at Bristol Sergeweaver
crime: No37/11 - 20th January 1751 - For assaulting Ann the wife of John Vinnicombe and unlawfully taking her from her Husband and carrying away 10s of his money. Bill found Michaelmas 1752. [comment] - Gone a Soldier.

No12/12 - 20th January 1753 - For stealing one pair of Boys Shoes val 1s-3d and one pair of Girls Shoes like value. Goods of Samuel Kerswell. Bill found Easter 1753. [comment] Ran away when first indicted.
No67/13 - 20th June 1755 - For assaulting Henry Jury. Bill found Midsummer 1755. [comment] Ran away when first indicted.
No14 - Presented by the G.I. for imbezzling 6lb weight of Wool delivered her to be spun. Bill found Michaelmas 1757.

person: Robert Middleweek alias Radford of Morchard Bishop Labourer
crime: No86/15 - 4th April 1759 - For assaulting Robert Tucker and Carrying away divers of his goods. Bill found Easter 1759. Tried Michaelmas 1767 and fined 1d on submission.
No98/16 - 28th October 1760 - For a combination and Confederacy against Francis Hite Gentleman. Bill found Midsummer 1761. [comment] Instructed Thomas Ward dead.

No38/18 - 14th June 1761 - For stealing one Iron Crock one Jack one Feather Pillow one Canvas Sheet on Ironing Box and two Iron Heaters the goods of William Pike. Bill found Easter 1762. [comment] Very poor [chance carrying]].
No33/19 - 29th September 1760 - For rescuing goods distrained by John Chamberlain. Bill found Xmas 1761.

No90/20 - 15th July 1767 - For assaulting Samuel Stephens one of the Overseers of the Poor of Crediton in the Execution of his office. 2nd Count, For a common Assault. Traversed Midsummer 1767. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 - Guilty and fined 1d and Imprisoned for 1 month.

No91/21 - 20th January 1767 - For running away and leqaving his two Children to the charge of Crediton Parish. Traversed Midsummer 1767. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 - Guilty, Whipped and Imprisoned for 3 months.

No22 - 10th September 1767 - For stealing one Holland Apron val 6d and one Cheque Apron val 6d the goods of John Dodderidge. Traversed Michaelmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No89/23 - 24th June 1766 - For running away and deserting his Children. Traversed Michaelmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tried Easter 1768 - Guilty fined 3s-4d and to be Imprisoned 6 months in Bridewell.

No260/24 - 15th March 1767 - For a nuisance by placing and leaving a Quantity of Stones, Dung, Dirt, Filth and other things in the Common Highway leading from Rocks Court to Northlakes in the parish of Sandford. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tried Xmas 1768 and fined 1d on submission.

No25 - 1st August 1767 - For stealing one Bell Metal Skillett val 3s and one Brass Chaffing Dish val 3s-6d the goods of William Browne. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tried Xmas 1768 - Guilty val 10d Whipped and Discharged.
No26 - 9th May 1768 - For stealing 5 Pecks of Wheat val 6s the goods of John Read. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No27 - 8th May 1768 - For stealing one leg of Beef 50lb weight val 10s the goods of John Clapp. 2nd Count, for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 - Guilty val 10d - Whipped and Discharged.
No290/28 - 16th April 1768 - For taking Excessive Toll in grinding Corn the goods of John Browne. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Xmas 1768 - Indictment Quashed.

No29 - 16th April 1768 - For stealing 20 yards of White Serge val 14s the goods of John Welsford. 2nd Count - for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 - Guilty val 10d Transported for Seven Years.
No30 - 1st November 1768 - For running away and Deserting his two Children. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Xmas 1769 and fined 1d on submission.
No298/31 - 16th April 1768 - For taking Excessive Toll in grinding the Corn of John Browne. Traversed Easter 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Midsummer 1769 - Guilty but Judgement Arrested.

person: Henry Gravell of Newton St. Cyres Labourer
crime: No331/32 - 12th September 9 George 3 - For assaulting Robert Southcott. Bill found Michaelmas 1769. Tried Xmas 1770 - fined 6d on submission.

No33 - 19th October 9 George 3 - For stealing one Silver Table Spoon val 2s the goods of Sir John Davie Baronet. 2nd Count for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Xmas 1770. Bill found Xmas 1770. Tried Xmas 1770 - Guilty val 6d Whipped and Imprisoned for one week.

person: John Golsworthy of Morchard Bishop Yeoman
crime: No335/34 - 25th November 10 George 3 - For assaulting Philip Tapp. Traversed Michaelmas 1770. Bill found Xmas 1770. Tried Xmas 1771 - and both found Not Guilty.

No36 - 11th June 10 George 3 - For unlawfully deserting his wife and 4 Children and leaving them to the charge of the parish of Crediton of 4£-13s-0d. Bill found Michaelmas 1770. Tried Michaelmas 1770 - Imprisoned six months in Bridewell.

No37 - 19th January 11 George 3 - For assaulting John Hookway the Younger. Bill found Easter 1771. Tried Easter 1771 - Imprisoned six Months in Gaol and six Months after in Bridewell - Whipped twice and kept to hard Labour.

No38 - 5th November 1770 11 George 3 - For unlawfully solliciting Mary Dell Apprentice to Robert Vicary to imbezzle 4lb weight of Wheat Flower made into Dough val 6d and unlawfully receiving the same knowing, etc. Bill found Midsummer 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 Imprisoned for one Month in Bridewell.

person: Hannah Weston w/o William Weston of Crediton Gunsmith
crime: No39 - 10th June 11 George 3 - For stealing one womans Holland Apron val 2s one womans Hatt val 1s and one yard of Black Silk Ribbon val 3d the goods of Sarah Hore. Traversed Midsummer 1771. Bill found Midsummer 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 - Guilty val 6d Whipped and Discharged.
No40 - 14th December 12 George 3 - For a nuisance by keeping a common Ill-governed and Disorderly House. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tried Xmas 1772 - Fined 1d and Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell.
No372/41- 1st January 11 George 3 - For unlawfully deserting his Wife and 3 Children and leaving them to the charge of ye parish of 3£. Bill found Xmas 1772.

person: Mary Horrell w/o Mark Horrell of Sandford Cordwainer
crime: No42 - 1st January 12 George 3 - For unjustly Detaining Imbezzling Purloining, etc, one worsted Chain val 9s, and 9lb weight of Obb Yarn val 12s, of one Samuel Browne delivered to her to be spun into Yarn and returned - contra form statute. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tried Easter 1772 - Guilty - Judgement arrested on motion - the offence not being Indictable [as lain] as the statute directs it to be determined in a Summary way before two Justices.

No43 - 19th March 12 George 3 - For assaulting Grace Cleave and threatening to Kill and Murder her. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tried Easter 1772 - Guilty - fined 1s Imprisoned in Bridewell for 6 months and to give Security for his good behaviour for 18 months.

No45 - 1st May 12 George 3 - For unlawfully Defrauding Richard Gould of 6s-8d by false pretences. Also charged with Defrauding Martha Edwards of 3s-6d by false prentences. Traversed Midsummer 1772. Bill found Midsummer 1772. Tried Midsummer 1772 - Not Guilty on both charges.

No46 - 17th February 12 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 100 Niches of Reed val 17s the goods of Peter Tucker, clerk. Traversed Michaelmas 1772. Bill found Michaelmas 1772. Tried Michaelmas 1772 - both found Not Guilty nor did fly.

No48 - 17th August 12 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 7s-6d in money from Mary Palmer. Traversed Micaelmas 1772. Bill found Michaelmas 1772. Tried Michaelmas 1772 - Guilty val 10d - Transported for Seven Years.

No49 - 3rd October 12 George 3 - For stealing 4lb of Wheaten Flour val 6d, 4lb weight of Wheaten Bread val 6d, and 3 Quarts of Milk val 1d ye goods of Robert Francis. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Eiphany 1773. Tried Epiphany 1773 - Guilty val 2d - Whipped and Discharged.

No50 - 3rd October 12 George 3 - For stealing a Peck of Meal val 6d, 4lb of Wheat Flour val 6d, and divers other goods of Robert Francis. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Epiphany 1773 - Guilty val 10d - Whipped and Discharged.

No51 - 21st February 13 George 3 - For stealing 2 Gallons Cyder val 1s the goods of Richard Read. Traversed Easter 1773. Bill found Easter 1773. Tried Easter 1773 - Guilty val 2d - Whipped and Discharged.

person: Mary Sanders w/o Samuel Sanders of Crediton Labourer
crime: No52 - 1st March 13 George 3 - For stealing 3 Nitches of Reed val 6d the goods of James Langaman. Traversed Midsummer 1773. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tried Midsummer 1773 - Guilty - Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell - Whipped and Discharged.

person: William Coles of Newton St. Cyres Husbandman
crime: No53 - 13th November 14 George 3 - For feloniously stealing a Guinea the goods of John Ellis. 2nd Count for the goods of William Ellis. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Epiphany 1774 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Mar Coles of Newton St. Cyres widow
crime: No54 - For feloniously receiving the said guinea knowing it to be stolen. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Epiphany 1774 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No55 - 20th december 14 George 3 - For contemptuously refusing to obey the orders of John Kelland Governor of the Workhouse there, etc. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Epiphany 1774 - Imprisoned in Bridewell for one month and whipped twice.

No452/56 - 9th March 15 George 3 - For assaulting Henry Guy and John Vinnicombe and rescuing divers Cattle distrained by them for Rent due to Nicholas Lightfoot Traversed Midsummer 1775. Bill found Eastr 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1775 - and both fined 1d on submission.
No58 - 9th September 15 George 3 - For assaulting Mary his wife. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tried Epiphany 1776 - Not Guilty.

No59 - 25th March 15 George 3 - For deserting his Child - ad Damp 4£-4s - in custody. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Epiphany 1776 - Guilty - Imprisoned two months in Bridewell and whipped twice.

person: John Leach of Crediton Cordwainer - Parish Constable
crime: No479/60 - 25th September 15 George 3 - For unlawfully neglecting and refusing to Execute return a Summons of [W.Charles] Carrington's. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tried Easter 1776 and fined 1d on submission.

No61 - 31st January 16 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Stephens [Overseer] two Counts. Traversed Easter 1776. Bill found Easter 1776. Tried Easter 1776 - Guilty - Imprisoned sic months in Bridewell and fined 1s on submission.
No483/62 - 12th April 16 George 3 - For assaulting Joshua Yeatherd and unlawfully breaking his Bell. Bill found Easter 1776.

No63 - 15th May 16 George 3 - For stealing 4 pieces of Elm Timber the goods of Sir John Chichester Bart, and John Parker, esq. 2nd Count, the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 Guilty val 11d Whipped twice and Imprisoned two months in Bridewell.

person: John Dodderidge Junior of Crediton Yeoman
crime: No497/64 - 6th January 17 George 3 - For a forcible entry into a Messuage there and Expelling William Browne the Younger, and other Enormities for which see pa 249 No 215. Traversed Easter 1777. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Tried Michaelmas 1777 - both Guilty and fined 1s each on submission.

No66 - 21st June 17 George 3 - For feloniously stealing a Shoulder of Mutton 8lb weight ye goods of Thomas Nickels. Traversed Midsummer 1777. Bill found Midsummer 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 - Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned 3 months in Bridewell, whipped twice and discharged.

No67 - 16th June 17 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 4 Cuweight of Hardwood the goods of Yeats Parr. 2nd count - for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Midsummer 1777. Bill found Midsummer 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 - both found Guilty val 8d and imprisoned 3 months in the Bridewell, whipped twice and discharged.

No509/69 - 19th April 17 George 3 - For unlawfully, wilfully, obstinately, and Contemptuously refusing to Execute the Office of overseer of the poor of the parish of Crediton being thereunto Lawfully Nominated. Traversed Michaelmas 1777. Bill found Midsummer 1777.

No70 - 29th September 17 George 3 - For assaulting Sarah Floud ux wm. Traversed 1777. Bill found Michelmas 1777. Tried Michaelmas 1777 - Guilty - Imprisoned 1 month in Bridewell, whipped twice and discharged.
No239/71 - 24th October 17 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Roach. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tried Easter 1778 - Not Guilty.

No72 - 27th December 18 George 3 - For assaulting John Quick the Porter of the Workhouse in Crediton. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tried Epiphany 1778 - Guilty Fined 6d and Imprisoned 6 months in Bridewell.

person: Elizabeth Hill of Newon St. Cyres Singlewoman
crime: No73 - 18th December 18 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 5 shillings in money - one womans Black Silk Hat, eight yards of Duroy and divers other Goods of Thomas Townsend. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tried Epiphany 1778 - Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned six weeks in Bridewell and whipped twice.
No74 - 4th November 19 George 3 - For assaulting Joseph Hole. Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Epiphany 1779. Tried Easter 1779 - Guilty - fined 1s and imprisoned in Bridewell one week.
No252/75 - 12th November 19 George 3 - For assaulting John Phillipps. Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Epiphany 1779. Tried Easter 1779 - severally Not Guilty.
No252/75 - 12th November 19 George 3 - For assaulting Christopher Saunders. Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Epiphany 1779. Tried Easter 1779 - severally Not Guilty.

person: Christopher Saunders Junior of Crediton Yeoman
crime: No543/83 - 12th November 19 George 3 - For assaulting Susanna Stoneman. Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Easter 1779. Tried Easter 1779 - Not Guilty.

person: Christopher Sanders Junior of Crediton Yeoman
crime: No544/84 - 12th November 19 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon Ann Wroth. Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Easter 1779. Tried Easter 1779 - all found Not Guilty.
No89 - 10th April 19 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 4lb weight of Beef val 5d Bon Simon Lane. Traversed Easter 1779. Bill found Easter 1779. Tried Easter 1779 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Mary Ffey alias Fay uxor James Ffey alias Fay of Colebrooke Labourer
crime: No90 - 26th May 19 George 3 - For stealing 5 1/2 Pecks of barley and one Peck of Wheat and two ffaggotts of wood the goods of Samuel Roach. Traversed Midsummer 1779. Bill found Midsummer 1779. Tried Midsummer 1779 - Guilty vl 10d Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell and Discharged.

person: James Fey alias Fay of Colebrooke Labourer
crime: No91 - 4th June 19 George 3 - For stealing 10 1/2 Pecks of Wheat val 12s-3d, Four Sheaves of Wheat val 4d, two Pecks of Meat Pease val 2s-6d, one Hempen Bag val 1s-6d, the goods of same Roach. Traversed Midsummer 1779.
No92 - 18th September 19 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Stephens Overseer of the Poor. Traversed Michaelmas 1779. Tried Michaelmas 1779 - and fined 1d on submission.

No93 - 1st december 20 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Backwill an Infant of 15 years old with an intent to commit sodomy. 2nd Count - Common assault. Traversed Epiphany 1780. Bill found Epiphany 1780. Tried Epiphany 1780 - Not Guilty.

person: Robert Tucker of Morchard Bishop Yeoman
crime: No562/94 - 1st June 19 George 3 - For unlawfully refusing to provide for Mary his wife - ad dmn 1£-8s-0d of the parish. Traversed Epiphany 1780. Bill found Easter 1780. Tried Midsummer 1780 - Guilty and fined 1s on submission.

person: Elizabeth alias Betty Lee ux Stephen Lee late of Crediton Labourer
crime: No95 - 5th July 20 George 3 - For unlawfully obtaining from John Lee one Silver watch val 4£, one silk Handkerchief val 4s, and 1 Guinea in Gold and 4s in Silver under a pretence of discovering to him hidden Treasure. Further charged Fo unlawfully obtaining from Mary Lee Singlewoman, one Gold Ring val 1£-6s-0d two pair of Silver Sleeve Buttons val 2s-6d and divers other goods under the like pretence. Traversed Midsummer 1780. Bill found Midsummer 1780. Tried Midsummer 1780 - found Guilty on both charges and Imprisoned in Bridewell for six months, ie; 3 months for each offence.

No97 - 25th September 19 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Piece of brown irish Sheeting in length of 4 yards val 30s the goods of John Cole. Traversed Easter 1781. Bill found Easter 1781, Tried Easter 1781 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Hannah Weston of Crediton Singlewoman a pauper
crime: No98 - 25th April 20 George 3 - For behaving in a riotous and abusive manner towards the Inhabitants and Parishioners of the said Parish and for selling her wearing apparell provided for her by the said Parish. Traversed Easter 1781. Bill found Easter 1781. Tried Easter 1781 - Guilty - Imprisoned 6 months in bridewell and Whipped 3 times.

person: Mary Clitsum uxor of Thomas Clitsum of the borough of Crediton Stonemason
crime: No99 - 1st September 21 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Rudall then being Portreeve of the said borough in the due execution of his office. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Tried Michaelmas 1781 - Not Guilty.

person: Mary Howard uxor John Howard of Crediton
crime: No100 - 27th October 22 George 3 - For unlawfully obtaining from Thomas Grudgeworthy one of the Overseers of the said Parish of Crediton Four Shillings, under false pretences. Traversed Epiphany 1782. Discharged she having fallen down in Court, broke her arm, and cut her Temple Artery, which was thought a sufficient punishment.

person: Mary Downe uxor William Downe of Newton St. Cyres
crime: No101 - 20th December 22 George 3 - For behaving in a Riotous, disorderly and abusive manner towards Elizabeth Downing her mother and several other poor persons belonging to the Poor House of the said Parish. Traversed Epiphany 1782. Tried Epiphany 1782 - Not Guilty.

No102 - 4th October 21 George 3 - For uttering and publishing several scandolous and malicious words intending to scandalize villify and injure James Carrington, Clerk, one of the Justices of the Peace of this County, and charging him with having acted partially in the Execution of his Office as Justice of the Peace - with 2 other Counts. Traversed Epiphany 1782.

No103 - 3rd june 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Pound Weight of Butter the goods of Richard Kerslake. Traversed Midsummer 1782. Bill found Midsummer 1782. Tried Midsummer 1782 - Guilty Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell.

No104 - 18th November 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 10lb weight of Wheaten Meal val 10d, and 6lb weight of Oatmeal val 6d the goods of John Drake. 2nd Count, the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Epiphany 1783. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Tried Epiphany 1783 - Guilty val 6d - Imprisoned Six weeks in Bridewell and whipped once.

No105 - 7th December 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing half of a Heifers Head val 6d, the goods of William Browne. Traversed Epiphany 1783. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Tried Epiphany 1783 - Guilty Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell and on Saturday the 1st February 1783 to be whipped at Crediton between the hours of 12 and 2, then remanded to Bridewell for the residue of the Month.
No106 - 26th August 22 George 3 - For neglecting to return a List of Jurors for the said parish of Colebrooke. Traversed Epiphany 1783.

No107 - 10th April 23 George 3 - For feloniously stea;ing ten pecks of unwinnowed wheat val 17s the goods of Joseph Wilson. Traversed Easter 1783. Bill found Easter 1783. Tried Easter 1783 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No108 - 4th March 23 George 3 - For behaving in a very riotuous and disorderly and abusive manner towards the inhabitants and parish of said parish of Crediton, unlawfully selling and disposing of her cloathes and other things provided for her by the said parish of Crediton. Bill found Easter 1783. Traversed Easter 1783. Tried Easter 1783 - Not Guilty.

person: Rebecca Kingdom of Crediton w/o John Kingdom
crime: No109 - 10th April 23 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Stephens [then being one of the Constables of the said parish of Crediton]. 2nd Count - common assault. Bill found Easter 1783. Tried Midsummer 1783 and fined 1d each on submission.

No1 - 19th March 1765 - For stealing 17 Gallons of Wheat val 11s, and one Hempen Bag val 2s the goods of Anthony Veale. 2nd Count for the goods of a person unknown. Bill found Xmas 1767. Tried Xmas 1767 - Guilty val 10d Whipped and Discharged.
No91/2 - 12th February 1768 - For stealing Ten Gallons of Brandy val 5£ the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No92/3 - 12th February 1768 - For stealing 6 Gallons of Brandy val 3£ [Ignored]. Traversed michaelmas 1768. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No93/4 - 12th February 1768 - For stealing 10 Gallons of Brandy val 5£. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 - Guilty val 10d - To be Imprisoned Six Months in Bridewell and find sureties for his good behaviour for 12 Months. Himself in 50£ and two sureties in 25£ each.

No94/5 - 12th February 1768 - For stealing 6 Gallons of Brandy val 3£. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 - Guilty val 10d - To be Imprisoned Six Months in Bridewell and find sureties for his good behaviour for 12 Months. Himself in 50£ and two sureties in 25£ each.

No278/9 - 12th February 1768 - For assaulting George Brutton an Agent for the salvage of a vessel commanded by Captain Andrews Lundstrom which was stranded and in the Execution of his office. 2nd count for a common assault. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Xmas 1768 - all fined 1d on submission.
No295/12 - 16th September 1768 - For not returning a List of Jurors. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Easter 1769 - fined 1d on submission.

No342/13 - 2nd September 8 George 3 - For contemptuously refusing to obey an order in Bastardy by Elizabeth Ching of Churstow. Traversed Easter 1771. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tried Midsummer 1771 - Guilty - To be imprisoned in Bridewell for One Year.

person: John Mountfort alias Mumford of Cornwood Yeoman
crime: No396/14 - 29th October 12 George 3 - For unlawfully retaining one William Bickford late a servant to Thomas Bradridge of Staverton Yeoman, without his having or producing a Testimonial. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Easter 1775 - fined 1s on submission.

person: Walter Macey of Aveton Gifford Hellier
crime: No417/15 - 13th September 12 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Walters. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tried Epiphany 1774 - fined 1s on submission.

person: Christopher Brooks junior of Ugborough Labourer
crime: No16 - 3rd January 18 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 1cu weight of Hay val 2s of Richard Winter. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tried Epiphany 1778 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No17 - 2nd April 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one pair of Boots val 3s and one pair of shoes val 2s the goods of John Henry Bridgeman. Traversed Midsummer 1783. Bill found Easter 1783. Tried Midsummer 1783 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No2/1 - 1st October 1745 - For unlawfully taking and carrying away one Black Grey Cock and three Black Cocks and 4 peck of winnowed Wheat val 3s-4d the goods of Henry Melhuish. Bill found Michaelmas 1745.

No24/2 - 21st September 1750 - For assaulting Henry Melhuish and Elizabeth his daughter. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1750. Tried [Drake] Midsummer 1769 - [Pulling] Michaelmas 1777 - [both] Not Guilty.
No42/4 - For disobeying a Summons from Justice Sheppard for her appearance before him to give account of her settlement. Bill found Easter 1753.

No11/5 - 20th April 1753 - For breaking and entering the Cyder Cellar of William Langley and stealing 30 gallons of Cyder val 20s, and one dozen and half of Glass Bottles filled with Ale val 5s, the goods of the said William. Bill found Easter 1753.

No59/6 - 6th October 1755 - For unlawfully cutting, taking and carrying away from Colford Common in Kenton parish a Land Score of Furze val 20s the property of Michael Bailey. Bill found Michaelmas 1755.
No16/7 - 23rd March 1756 - For stealing one bundle of Faggott Bind val 1s the goods of john Balle. Bill found Easter 1756.
No75/8 - 10th April 1757 - For assaulting Sarah [uxor] Thomas Dyer. Bill found Michaelmas 1757.
No37/9 - 10th February 1762 - For stealing 200 Oysters val 1s ye goods of Hugh Lord Clifford. Bill found Easter 1762.

person: John Cole of West Teignmouth Labourer
crime: No36/10 - 20th March 1762 - For stealing 500 Oysters val 2s Goods pdict. Bill found Easter 1762.
No35/11 - 15th September 1761 - For stealing 200 Oysters val 1s goods of said Lord Clifford. Bill found Easter 1762.
No34/12 - 31st August 1761 - For the like offence [stealing 200 Oysters val 1s goods of Lord Clifford]. Bill found Easter 1762.
No126/13 - 23rd June 1764 - For a Riot and Assault upon Joseph Davey. Bill found Midsummer 1764.
No127/18 - 23rd June 1764 - For a Riot and Assault upon Edmund Freeborn. Bill found Midsummer 1764.
No128/22 - 23rd June 1764 - For a Riot and Assault upon Charles Bowden. Bill found Midsummer 1764.
No143/26 - 26th July 1764 - For an assault upnon George White at the Banks of Newfoundland in parts beyond the seas. Bill found Xmas 1765. Tried Xmas 1770 - fined 6d on submission.
No137/27 - 11th March 1765 - For assaulting Andrew Periam. Bill found Easter 1765. Tried Epiphany 1773 - fined 6d on submission.

No13/30 - 21st September 1752 - For unlawfully breaking and entering the Dwelling House of William Day and carrying away divers goods val 40s. Traversed michaelmas 1753. Bill found Midsummer 1753.
No184/31 - 2nd June 1766 - For assaulting Thomas Hammond. Traversed Michaelmas 1765. Bill found Midsummer 1766. Tried Xmas 1767 - Guilty fined 1d on submission.

Also charged for stealing one pair Buckskin Breeches val 10s, one silver Stock Buckle val 1s-6d, and one Holland Stock val 6d the goods of William Taylor. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tried Michaelmas 1766 - Guilty val 10d - Transported for Seven Years.

No75/34 - 11th August 1766 - For assaulting Michael Pulling. Also charged with assaulting Charles Bowden. Traversed Michaelmas 1766. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tried Xmas 1767 - and fined 1d on each charge on submission.
No212/36 - 20th September 1766 - For assaulting William Gravells. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tried Xmas 1767 - Stokes/Hutchings fined 1d each on submission - Salter fined 6d on submission.

No220/39 - 13th December 1766 - For forestalling Two bags of Potatoes containing about 20 Peck both of William Wood. Traversed Midsummer 1767. Bill found Xmas 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 - Not Guilty.

No230/40 - 15th April 1767 - For rescuing one Black Gelding his property distrained by George Tothill for Damage Feasant and for assaulting the said George Tothill. Bill found Easter 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 - fined 1d on submission.

No280/41 - 10th November 1767 - For buying of Richard Hicks 2 Oxen and afterward 17th December 1767, selling the same again to Samuel Saterly for £18-10s-0d not having kept the same 5 weeks. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Xmas 1770 - Not Guilty.

person: John Potter junior of Dawlish Labourer
crime: No106/42 - 4th July 1768 - For stealing one Lobster val 3d the goods of John Connett. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 - Not guilty nor did fly.

person: John Potter junior of Dawlish Labourer
crime: No107/44 - 18th June 1768 - For the like offence [For stealing one Lobster val 3d the goods of John Connett]. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 - Guilty - Whipped and Discharged.
No126/46 - 23rd May 1768 - For asaulting Francis Holmes of Kingsteignton. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 - Not Guilty.
No286/47 - 25th May 1768 - For violently assaulting and biting Noah Barry junior. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 fined 1d on submission.
No295/48 - 1st July 1768 - For assaulting Ann West [Watt] at Powderham. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 - Not Guilty.

No49 - 6th August 1768 - For stealing one Linen Cap val 2d, one pair of Worsted Stockings val 2d, one Woollen Cloak val 2d, and one Cotton Handkerchief val 2d the goods of Richard Arthur. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 - Guilty Whipped and Discharged.

person: Jane Shilson of Starcross in Kenton widow
crime: No118/50 - 28th June 1768 - For assaulting Mary the wife of George Kendle. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 - Not Guilty.
No321/51 - 1st April 1769 - For assaulting Elizabeth Dart his daughter aged 8 years. Traversed Midsummer 1769. Bill found Easter 1769. Tried Michaelmas 1769 - Not Guilty.

person: Edward Rowe of Bishops Torrington Labourer
crime: No322/52 - 11th June 9 George 3 - For assaulting James Marshall. Bill found Midsummer 1769. Tried Xmas 1770 - fined 6d on submission.

crime: No139/53 - 1st September 9 George 3 - For assaulting John Balle. Traversed Michaelmas 1769. Bill found Michaelmas 1769. Tried Xmas 1770 - Guilty fined 3s-4d on submission.

No331/55 - 25th August 9 George 3 - For assaulting Elizabeth Valentine widow. Traversed Easter 1770. Bill found Xmas 1770. Tried Midsummer 1770 - Not Guilty.

person: Mary Sully w/o Willia Sully of Kenn Mariner
crime: No58 - 16th April 10 George 3 - For assaulting Mary Clarke. Bill found Easter 1770. Tried Easter 1770 fined 6d on submission.

No357/61 - 21st June 10 George 3 - For a nuisance in unlawfully Laying Rubbish in the Highway leading from the [Messuages] of Higher Duncombe to Chudleigh. Bill found Easter 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 - fined 6d on submission.

person: Catherine Dinneford w/o John Dinneford of Ide Yeoman
crime: No173/62 - 29th October 12 George 3 - For assaulting Ann Casely. Traversed Xmas 1772. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tried Easter 1772 - Bayley fined 6d and Dinneford fined 1s-0d on submission.

No64 - 9th April 12 George 3 - For stealing 5 Yards of Blossom Colour yard wide woollen stuff val 2s the goods of James Rivers. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tried Easter 1772 - Guilty val 10d Whipped and discharged.

No65 - 24th August 17 George 3 - For milking two Cows of John Anning and stealing 3 Quarts of milk val 3d. Traversed Michaelmas 1772. Bill found Michaelmas 1772. Tried Michaelmas 1772 - Guilty Whipped and Discharged.

person: Charity Milton w/o john Milton of Chudleigh Labourer
crime: No66 - 20th November 13 George 3 - For stealing 4 1/2 Gallons of winnowed wheat val 3s the goods of Joses Ellis. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Epiphany 1773 - Guilty val 2d Whipped and Discharged.
No67 - 20th October 12 George 3 - For stealing 7 Pecks of Wheat val 10s the goods of Francis Piecce. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Epiphany 1773 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

crime: No398/68 - 10th August 12 George 3 - For assaulting Francis Upham. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Epiphany 1773 fined 2s on submission.
No69 - 10th May 13 George 3 - For stealing 40cu weight of Hay val 1s the goods of Samuel Lambell. Traversed Midsummer 1773. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tried Midsummer 1773 - Not Guilty nor did fly.e
No70 - 24th August 13 George 3 - For assaulting Ann the wife of Roger Mortimore. Traversed Michaelmas 1773. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tried Epiphany 1774 - Not Guilty.
No72 - 10th April 14 George 3 - For stealing 3s the moneys of Thomas Underhay. Traversed Easter 1774. Bill found Easter 1774. Tried Easter 1774 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No73 - 24th December 14 George 3 - For stealing 4 Peck of Wheat val 3d ye goods of Richard Arthur. Traversed Midsummer 1774. Bill found Midsummer 1774. Tried Midsummer 1774 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No457/75 - 27th March 15 George 3 - For assaulting Edward Timewell. Bill found Easter 1775. Traversed Michaelmas 1776. Tried Michaelmas 1776 - both found Not Guilty.

person: Richard Penson of West Teignmouth Mariner
crime: No462/77 - 20th Mrch 15 George 3 - For assaulting John Greenslade. Bill found Easter 1775. Traversed Midsummer 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1775 - Guilty and fined 1s.

Bill found Midsummer 1775. Traversed Midsummer 1775. Tried Midsummer 1775 - Guilty val 6d, Imprisoned in Bridewell 6 weeks whipped twice and discharged.

No79 - 14th September 15 George 3 - For stealing 7 Turkeys val 14s the goods of William Clarke. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1775 - Guilty both to be Transported for Seven Years.

person: Jane Barnett of West Teignmouth widow
crime: No477/81 - 1st March 16 George 3 - For a forcible entry into a Dwelling House with the Appurtenances there and expelling Thomas Williams therefrom. Bill found Easter 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - fined 6d on submission.

No83 - 25th June 16 George 3 - For stealing two Fowls val 6d the goods of Benjamine Best. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - Guilty whipped twice and Imprisoned three Months in Bridewell.

No84 - 3rd July 16 George 3 - For stealing one pair of Stockings val 6d ye goods of William Young. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - Guilty Whipped and Discharged.

person: Theadosia Woosely w/o John Woosely of Kenton Mariner
crime: No497/88 - 5th October 16 George 3 - For assaulting John Haydon. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Tried Easter 1777 - Not Guilty.

No499/89 - 1st October 16 George 3 - For unlawfully suffering the Hedges and Fences of his Curtilage in Kenton to be out of repair whereby Cattle strayed into the grounds of Robert Tyte and others. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Traversed Easter 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 - fined 1s on submission.
No503/90 - 1st July 16 George 3 - For assaulting William Potter there. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Traversed Easter 1777. Tried Midsummer 1777 - fined 1s on submission.

No93 - 7th July 18 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Chapple. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tried Epiphany 1779 - both ffined 6d on submission.

person: Joseph Tucker of West Teignmouth Joyner
crime: No540/95 - 14th October 18 George 3 - For rescuing himself out of the Bridewell in Bastardy. Bill found Epiphany 1779. Tried Epiphany 1780 - Fined 1s on submission.

Bill found Epiphany 1781. Traversed Epiphany 1781. Tried Eiphany 1781 - Guilty val 9d - Imprisoned [first charge] Six Months in Bridewell and whipped 3 times. [Second charge] Not Tryed on this being found Guilty and punished on the last.

No101 - 1st January 19 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting his son and leaving him to the Charge of the Parish 5£. Bill found Epiphany 1781. Traversed 1781. Tried Epiphany 1781 - Guilty fined One Penny.

person: John Kallendar of West Teignmouth Labourer
crime: No103 - 16th September 21 George 3 - For assaulting Richard Sarell with an Intent to committ that most horrid detestable and Sodomitical Crime called Buggary. 2nd count Common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tried Michaelmas 1781 - Guilty - Fined 5 Marks Imprisoned in Bridewell six months separated and apart from the other Prisoners. To be set in a Pillory in the town of Newton Bushell for the space of one hour. To find security for his good behaviour himself in 50£ and two securities in 25£ each.
No104 - 5th December 22 George 3 - For assaulting Laurence Weston. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Traversed Easter 1782. Tried Midsummer 1782 - Not Guilty.

person: Martha Drake of West Teignmouth Singlewoman
crime: No106 - 26th December 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one pair of Metal Shoe Buckles val 1s, one pair of Steel Shoe Buckles plated with Silver val 2s-6d, and two pair of Black Worsted Mitts val 2s the goods of Charles Brooks. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Traversed Easter 1783. Tried Easter 1783 - both found Not Guilty nor did fly.

No1 - For absenting from the Grand Jury after being duly sworn. Presented by the G.J. at Michaelmas 1761.

person: George Short of Great Torrington Labourer

Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tried Xmas, Easter and Michaelmas 1767 - Burnett fined 6d on submission; Launder, Headon and Saunders, each fined 1d on submission. Chapman, Westlake and Whitehead also fined 1d on submission. Horne also fined 1d on submission.

crime: No269/21 - 5th October 1767 - For assaulting John Lock junior. Also charged with assaulting Robert Trewin. Bill found Michaelmas 1767.

crime: No475/42 - 27th March 16 George 3 - For a Riot and assault upon William Snelling a Sheriffs officer. 2nd Count - Common Assault. Bill found Easter 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - both fined 1s on submission.

crime: No32 - 1st April 14 George 3 - For stealing one Iron Hatchett val 2d the goods of John Westcott. Traversed easter 1774. Bill found Easter 1774. Tried Easter 1774 - Guilty val 1d - Imprisoned 3 days in Bridewell and whipped once.

person: William Snell of Bradnich Parish Constable
crime: No9 - Presented at Michaelmas 1762 by Edward Davie Hundred Constable for not returning a list of Jurors.
No119/10 - 1st August 1763 - For assaulting Joseph Dann. Bill found Michaelmas 1763.

No146/11 - 6th April 1765 - For a forcible entry into a tenement or Dwelling House in Cullompton in the possessoion of William Cross and expelling and keeping him out. Bill found Easter 1765. Tried Midsummer 1766 - fined 6d on submission.
No163/12 - 29th October 1765 - For extortion in receiving 4£-4s-0d off Thomas Martyn, Gent, for arresting him. Bill found Xmas 1766.
No63/13 - 18th November 1765 - For assaulting Richard Stephens. Traversed Easter 1766. Bill found Xmas 1766. Tried Michaelmas 1766 - fined 6d on submission.
No104/14 - 9th July 1762 - For assaulting Mary Martyn. Bill found Midsummer 1762. Tried Michaelmas 1766 - John Warren fined 6d on submission - Andrew Warren fined 1d on submission.

No71/16 - 29th April 1766 - For stealing 3/4 of a Peck of Wheat val 11d, the goods of Samuel Kingdon. 2nd Count - for the goods of a person unknown. Bill found Midsummer 1766. Tried Midsummer 1766 - Guilty whipped and discharged.

person: Robert More Yeoman Parish Constable of Peahembury
crime: No195/17 - 29th September 1765 - For not returning a list of Jurors. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1766. Tried Xmas 1769 - Not Guilty.

person: William Monder Yeoman Parish Constable of Bradnich
crime: No196/18 - 29th September 1765 - For not returning a List of Jurors. Bill found Midsummer 1766.
No19 - 30th July 1766 - For running away from his family. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tried Michaelmas 1766 - Whipped and Discharged.
No87/20 - 26th October 1766 - For assaulting William Sprague. Traversed Xmas 1767. Bill found Xmas 1767. Tried Easter 1767 - fined 1d on submission.
No90/21 - 24th November 1766 - For assaulting Thomas Heathfield. Traversed Xmas 1767. Bill found Xmas 1767. Tried Easter 1767 - fined 1d on submission.

No86/22 - 19th February 1767 - For assaulting Nicholas Horden a Parish Constable of the Parish of Thorverton. 2nd Count - for assault on Nicholas Horden. Traversed Easter 1767. Bill found Easter 1767. Tried Midsummer 1767 - Guilty - fined one Guinea and committed to Bridewell for Three Months and till he pays the fine.

person: Mary Pine w/o Samuel Pine of Peahembury Labourer
crime: No92/23 - 9th June 1767 - For threatening to set fire to Burndown and destroy the Churchtown of Peahembury. Traversed Midsummer 1767. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tried Michaelmas 1767 - Not Guilty.
No24 - 1st January 1765 - For Deserting his Male Child a Cripple. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tried Xmas 1768 - To be whipped 3 times and Imprisoned 6 months in Bridewell.

person: Mary Challis w/o Joseph Challis of Cullompton Labourer
crime: No25 - 20th October 1767 - For stealing Three Bee Hives with the Bees therein val 20s the goods of John Coleman. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tried Xmas 1768 - Ann Challis Not Guilty nor did fly - Sarah Challis Guilty val 1s - Whipped and Discharged - Mary Challis Not Guilty nor did fly - Mary Challis w/o Joseph Challis Guilty val 1s Whipped and Discharged.

No29 - 9th March 1768 - For stealing one Scotch Lawn Handkerchief val 1s; One Spotted linen Handkerchief val 2s; one Muslin Handkerchief val 1s; two ruffle Cuffs val 6d; a piece of printed Linnen val 6d; and a breadth of a Silk Petticoat val 6d, the goods of Henry Langford Brown, esq. 2nd Count for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Easter 1768 - Iset Street Guilty val 10d - Whipped and Discharged - Frances Street - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No275/31 - 19th November 1767 - For a Riot at Broadclist and breaking, pulling down, Burning and Destroying a Bunting Mill and the utensils of a Water Greist Mill val 19£ belonging to one Thomas Burrow. 2nd Count - for a Riot and Assault upon the said Thomas Burrow. Bill found Easter 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1769 - all found Guilty and fined 6d each on submission.

No42 - 1st January 1768 - For running away and leaving his wife and two children a charge to the parish of Cullompton. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 - To be Imprisoned in Bridewell for one Month.
No43 - 1st January 1768 - For the like offence [see above]. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Midsummer 1768 - fined 1d on submission.

No123/44 - 20th May 1768 - For unlawfully running away and leaving his three Children a chrge to the parish of Cadeleigh. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 and fined 6d on submission.

No285/45 - 14th June 1768 - For refulsing to provide for James Cummings his parish Apprentice and leaving him chargeable to the parish of Broadhembury who have expended 6£-11s-1d in his maintainance. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 - Not Guilty - no evidence given; the Indictment being adjudged bad.

No117/46 - 28th September 1768 - For assaulting Thomas Price an Excise Officer in the Execution of his Office. 2nd Count - for a common assault. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 - Removed by Certiorari into the Court of the Kings Bench.
No302/47 - 17th August 1768 - For assaulting William Pollexfen Penfound at Silferton. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Xmas 1769 and fned 6d on submission.

No48 - 10th December 1768 - For stealing one white Whitney Jacket val 3s; one pair of Copper Shoe Buckles val 6d; and one Steel Bottle Screw val 6d the goods of Robert Dunstar. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Xmas 1769 - Guilty val 6d Whipped and Discharged.
No309/49 - 1st June 1767 - For assaulting James Cummings. Traversed Easter 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Midusmmer 1769 - Not Guilty.

person: Thomas Back the younger of Thorverton Yeoman
crime: No310/50 - For assaulting Joseph Westcott. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Easter 1769 - Thomas Black Not Guilty - Thomas Back the younger fined 1d on submission.
No318/52 - 10th January 1769 - For Cheating and Defrauding William Upton of 30 Seams of Straw val 20s. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Easter 1769 and fined 1d on submission.
No138/53 - 11th September 9 George 3 - For assaulting Mary Dommett. Bill found Easter 1769. Tried Midsummer 1769 and fined 6d on submission.

person: Ann Moxey w/o William Moxey of Thorverton Labourer
crime: No323/54 - 15th September 9 George 3 - For rescuing a Calf val 1£-3s-0d distrained by Robert Norrish for arrears of Rent due to Robert Smith. Traversed Michaelmas 1769. Bill found Michaelmas 1769. Tried Xmas 1770 - fined 6d on submission.

No329/55 - 16th September 9 George 3 - For assaulting Ann the wife of William Moxey and forcibly and unlawfully breaking and Entering her Dwelling House. Traversed Xmas 1770. Bill found Michaelmas 1769. Tried Xmas 1770 and both found Not Guilty.

No330/57 - 28th September 9 George 3 - For assaulting John Russell Moore, and for threatening to kill and murder him with a Pick. Traversed Xmas 1770. Bill found Michaelmas 1769. Tried Easter 1770 and both fined 6d on submission.

No59 - 9th April 10 George 3 - For unlawfully running away and leaving his wife and 4 children to the charge of the parish of Cullompton 20£. Traversed Easter 1770. Bill found Easter 1770. Tried Easter 1770 - Not Guilty in Custody.

No60 - 30th July 10 George 3 - For the like offence above - ad damp 5£. Traversed Easter 1770. Bill found Easter 1770. Tried Easter 1770 - Guilty in custody - To be Imprisoned in Bridewell 1 Month and untill he gives security for maintaining his family.
No61 - 20th May 10 George 3 - For the like offence ad damp Silferton 3£-4s-0d. Traversed Midsummer 1770. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tried Midsummer 1770 and fined 1d on submission.

No62 - 1st July 9 George 3 - For the like offence ad dam parish of Cullompton 4£. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tried Midsummer 1770 - To be imprisoned in Bridewell 3 Months, whipped 4 times and discharged.
No63 - 1st July 9 George 3 - For the like offence ad dam Cullompton 7£. Bill found Midsummer 1770. tried Midsummer 1770 - Whipped and Discharged.

No64 - 2nd January 10 George 3 - For stealing one Dragg with Iron Tings val 5s the goods of John Martin. Traversed Midsummer 1770. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tried Midsummer 1770 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No348/65 - 1st June 10 George 3 - For assaulting Hannah Bowditch. Traversed Michaelmas 1770. Bill foundMidsummer 1770. Tried Xmas 1771 - Not Guilty.
No66 - 3rd November 11 George 3 - For assaulting Elizabeth Coombe. Bill found Xmas 1771. Tried Xmas 1771 - fined 3s-4d on submission.

person: Mary Anning w/o Robert Anning of Tallaton Miller
crime: No67 - 27th November 11 George 3 - For stealing one Skain of Dark coloured Worsted val 2s the goods of John Venning. Traversed Xmas 1771. Bill found Xmas 1771. Tried Xmas 1771 - Guilty val 6d Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell.
No356/68 - 10th October 10 George 3 - For assaulting John Vowler and unlawfully Breaking and Entering his Dwelling House. Bill found Xmas 1771. Tried Easter 1771 - fined 1s on submission.

No355/69 - 21st February 11 George 3 - For unlawfully and contemptuously neglecting and refusing to appear before Henry Walrond, esq, when summoned to be examined to his settlement. Bill found Easter 1771. Tried Midsummer 1771 - fined 6d and committed to Bridewell for 3 months.

person: Samuel Butt junior of Thorverton Labourer
crime: No70 - 1st January 11 George 3 - For leaving his two Children to ye Charge of that parish of 5£. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tried Xmas 1772 - Whipped and Discharged.
No71 - 30th June 11 George 3 - For stealing one pint of Cyder val 2d the goods of William Frost. Traversed Xmas 1772. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tried Xmas 1772 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No373/73 - 14th January 12 George 3 - For a forcible entry into a dwelling house there in the possession of Joan Mare widow. Also charged with assaulting Joan Mare. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tried Midsummer 1772 - Not Guilty on both charges.

No170/75 - 4th April 12 George 3 - For stealing 4lb weight of Wheat Flour val 6d and Six Quarts of Cyder val 1s the goods of John O'Cock. Traversed Midsummer 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tried Midsummer 1772 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No185/76 - 5th December 13 George 3 - Being an End Gatherer was found at Crediton unlawfully Receiving, Carrying, and Conveying 10lb weight of Wefts, 10lb weight of Thrums; 10lb weight of yarns, in a bag convenient for that purpose, against the form of the statute, etc. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Easter 1773 and removed by Certiorari.

No77 - 30th October 13 George 3 - For stealing one Canvas sheet val 2s; three pair of Worsted val 3s; and 3 pair of Yarn Stockings val 1s; and one womans Leather Shoe val 1s-6d, the goods of John Paw. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Epiphany 1773 - Guilty val 10d - Whipped and Discharged.

No78 - 11th October 12 George 3 - For stealing one Holland Shirt val 5s, 2 Holland shifts val 1s; and 1/2 a peck of Potatoes val 3d; the goods of John Russell Moore. Traversed Epiphany 1773. No389/80 - 9th August 12 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting his Three Children and leaving them to the charge of that Parish of 4£-16s-0d. Bill found Epiphany 1773.

No81 - 12th April 13 George 3 - For stealing one White Silk Cloak val 3d; half a Yard of Linen val 2d, and divers other goods of John Turner. Traversed Easter 1773. Bill found Easter 1773. Tried Easter 1773 - Guilty val 2d - Whipped and Discharged.
No181/82 - 1st July 13 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Heathfield at Cullompton. Traversed Midsummer 1773. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tried Michaelmas 1773 - Removed by Certiorari.
No414/84 - 1st July 13 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Bird at Cullompton. Bill found Midsummer 1773.

person: Thomas Luxton junior of Cullompton Woolcomber
crime: No183/85 - 14th September 13 George 3 - For assaulting John Pigeon. Traversed Michaelmas 1773. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tried Epiphany 1774 - John Luxton fined 1s on submikssion - remainder all Not Guilty.

No90 - 17th December - For unlawfully Refusing to Obey an order in Bastardy. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Epiphany 1774 - Imprisoned for 14 days and until he find security for the performance of ye order.

No425/91 - 19th April 12 George 3 - For unlawfully refusing to provide for William Gouldsworthy his parish apprentice to the charge of the parish of Buckrell of £6. Traversed Michaelmas 1774. Bill found Easter 1774. Tried Epiphany 1774 and fined 1s on submission.
No452/92 - 30th december 15 George 3 - For assaulting Elias Baker. Traversed Easter 1775. Bill found Epiphany 1775. Tried Midsummer 1775 - and fined 1s on submission.

No468/93 - 15th August George 3 - For unlawfully rescuing Stephen Oliver and Thomas Lipscombe out of the hands of Hugh Matthews Constable of the parish of Silferton under a Justices Warrant and for assaulting the said Hugh Matthews. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1776 - Both fined 1d and to give good security for his good behaviour for two years.

No95 - For unlawfully rescuing himself out of the custody of said Matthews and charged as aforesaid. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1776 - both fined 1d and to give good security for their good behaviour.

No469/97 - 15th August 15 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon John Row at Silverton. Traversed Eiphany 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1776 - All offenders fined 6d and to give good security for their good behaviour for two years - except William Tapper Not Guilty - No evidence being given having been before convicted on the Indictment No470.

No470/107 - 15th August 15 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon Joseph Head at Silverton. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tried Michaelmas 1776 - All offenders fined 6d and to give good security for their good behaviour for two years - except William Tapper in custody and found Guilty - Fined 5£ imprisoned in High Gaol for 2 Years and untill he gives good security, etc, for 3 Years after - and Samuel Pepperell in custody and Guilty - fined 5£ and Imprisoned in High Gaol for two years and untill he gives good security for his good behaviour for 3 years after himself in 50£ and two good securities in 25£ each or one in 50£ and untill the Fine paid. Comment - same as William Tapper.
No117 - 25th March 16 George 3 - For stealing 11 Bundles of Hay val 6s the goods of Richard Potter junior. Traversed Easter 1776. Bill found Easter 1776. Tried Easter 1776 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No486/118 - 30th March 16 George 3 - For assaulting Richard Norrish. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tried Epiphany 1777 - fined 1s on submission.

crime: No119 - 2nd July 16 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 14 yards of Black Silk Lace val 11s; ye goods of Elizabeth Hollett. 2nd Count - for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Michaelmas 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tried Michaelmas 1776 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No504/120 - 30th November 17 George 3 - For assaulting Matthew Mundy at Ottery St. Mary. Traversed Epiphany 1777.
No121 - 17th January 17 George 3 - For assaulting William Dyer. Traversed Easter 1777. Tried Easter 1777 - fined 1s on submmission.

crime: No545/126 - 8th January 19 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Drewe. Bill found Epiphany 1779. Tried Easter 1779 and all fined 1d on submission.

Bill found Easter 1780. Traversed Midsummer 1780. Tried Michaelmas 1780 - Quashed at Michaelmas 1780.
No134 - 4th September 20 George 3 - For assaulting Mary his wife. Bill found Michaelmas 1780. Traversed michaelmas 1780. Tried Michaelmas 1780 - Guilty and fined 1d.

person: William Clarke the younger of Kentisbeare Carpenter
crime: No585/135 - 2nd January 21 George 3 - For assaulting John Pullen Constable of Kentisbeare in the Execution of his Office. 2nd count - common assault. Bill found Epiphany 1781. Traversed Midsummer 1783. Tried Midsummer 1783 - Guilty of 2nd Count only Fined 1s and Imprisoned in Bridewell one Month.
No137 - For feloniously stealing one Hand Saw val 2s the goods pf Alexander Goss. Bill found Midsummer 1781. Traversed Midsummer 1781. Tried Midsummer 1781 - Not Guilty.

No139 - 1st September 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing two dozen of Ash Hoops val 2s the goods of Philip Upcott. Further charged with stealing Two Geese val 6d and two Ducks val 6d the goods of Joseph Prowse. And further charged with stealing one Cock val 6d; one Hen val 6d; two Chicken val 6d and 4 quarts of Cyder val 4d the goods of Robert Smith. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tried Michaelmas 1781 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No285/142 - 1st September 21 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Harris. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tried Epiphany 1782 - Guilty Imprisoned 2 Hours in Bridewell Fined 10s and untill, etc.

No143 - 9th October 21 George 3 - For receiving and having one piece of Ash timber in Length about 12foot val 6d; the goods of William Iliff knowing the same to be stolen. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Discharged the Principals being only convicted of Petty Larcency.

No144 - 9th December 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Duck val 8d and one Mallard val 8d the goods of John Fortescue. 2nd Count, the goods of a person unknown. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tried Epiphany 1782 - Guilty val 6d - Imprisoned 1 hour and discharged having Inlisted in the Sea Service.

No263/145 - 1st October 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Cock val 6d; one Hen val 6d; two Chicken val 6d, and four quarts of Cyder val 1s the goods of Robert Smith. Further charged with stealing two Ducks val 6d; two Geese val 1s, the goods of Joseph Prowse. Turpin Prowse was further charged with stealing 24 Ash Hoops val 2s the goods of Philip Upcott. Bill found Epiphany 1782.
No154 - 17th December 22 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon Joshua Rowe. 2nd Count - Common assault. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tried Epiphany 1782 - Not Guilty.
No157 - 8th April 22 George 3 - For unlawfully obtaining from Phineas Mackworth Praed, esquire, 1£-1s-0d under false pretences. Bill found Easter 1782 Tried Easter 1782. Not Guilty.
No158 - 2nd October 22 George 3 - For assaulting Abraham Moxey, then sheriffs officer in the due execution of his office. 2nd Count - Common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1782.
No159 - 1st December 23 George 3 - For unlawfully refusing to provide for Richard Westcott his parish apprentice to the charge of the parish of Thorverton of 20s. Bill found Epiphany 1783.

crime: No26/1 - 17th August 1750 - For assaulting Abraham Stancombe. Bill found Easter 1751.

No5 - 16th August 1766 - For assaulting William Mann. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tried Michaelmas 1766 - fined 1d on sub,mission.

crime: No8 - 1st August 1768 - For stealing 3 Iron Drag Tangs val 1s, the goods of John King. Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tried Michaelmas 1768 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No9 - 30th September 1768 - For stealing 60 ffeet of Elm Boards val 6s, the goods of Broure Trist, esquire. 2nd Count - for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Xmas 1769 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: John Bickford Parish Constable of Ipplepen
crime: No296/10 - 5th January 1769 - For unlawfully, contemptuously neglecting and refusing to convey Francis Holmes then in his Custody for a felony to Bridewell as by a warrant from John Wills, esq, he was commanded. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tried Easter 1769 - fined 1d on submission.

No358/13 - 8th July 10 George 3 - For assaulting William Coysh at St. Johns Harbour in the Island of Newfoundland. Bill found Xmas 1771. Tried Easter 1771 - fined 1s on submission.

No16 - 29th A;pril 12 George 3 - For stealing one Hempen Bag val 2s-6d, and two Bushels of Barley val 6s-6d the goods of William Croote. Traversed Midsummer 1772. Bill found Midsummer 1772. Tried Midsummer 1772 - Guilty val 8d Whipped and Discharged.
No 382/17 - 9th May 12 George 3 - For Assaulting Mary Peeters. Traversed Michaelmas 1772. Bill found Midsummer 1772. Tried Epiphany 1773 - Not Guilty.

crime: No397/18 - 10th December 13 George 3 - For assaulting Elizabeth Cooke his apprentice aged 10 years. Traversed Michaelmas 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Epiphany 1775 - Not Guilty.

crime: No20 - 22nd november 14 George 3 - For stealing one Silver Watch val 3£ the goods of George Pillar. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Epiphany 1774 - Guilty val 6d - Transported for Seven Years.

No22 - For feloniously receiving the said two Hempen Bags Scienter, etc. Bill found Epiphany 1774. [comment] Could not be tryed - the Principal being Acquitted.

crime: No447/33 - 19th November 15 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Snelling. Traversed Easter 1775. Bill found Epiphany 1775. Tried Easter 1776 - fined 1d on submission.

person: James Palmer of Ottery St. Mary Blacksmith
crime: No179/10 - 21st October 12 George 3 - For assaulting William Potbury. Traversed 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Easter 1773 and removed by Certiorari.

person: John Mitchell of Ottery St. Mary Butcher
crime: No180/12 - 21st October 12 George 3 - For assaulting Robert Shepheard. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tried Easter 1773 and removed by Certiorari.

person: Joseph Sorrell of Ottery St. Mary Perukmaker
crime: No181/15 - 28th August 12 George 3 - For assaulting James Tiller. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tried Easter 1774 - Guilty fined 20£ and committed to High Gaol for one Month and untill payment of fine.

person: Sarah Trenew w/o Joseph Trenew of Ottery St. Mary Schoolmaster
crime: No440/16 - 30th August 14 George 3 - For assaulting Samuel Pierce. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Bill found ersedMichaelmas 1774. Tried Easter 1776 - No Fine - Tremme convert.

person: Honor Jennings of Ottery St. Mary Singlewoman
crime: No17 - 17th November 15 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one pair of Black Worsted Stockings val 3d the goods of Anthony Nix. Traversed Epiphany 1775. Bill found Epiphany 1775. Tried Epiphany 1775 - Guilty To be Imprisoned Six Months in Bridewell and whipped twice.

person: William oxenham of Ottery St. Mary Officer of Excise
crime: No441/18 - 16th September 14 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon John Cheek junior with several counts. Bill found Epiphany 1775.

person: Stephen Coles of Ottery St. Mary Yeoman
crime: No 21 - 1st March 17 George 3 - For disobeying an order of this Court in not paying Two Guineas to Henry Lewis, clerk overseer of Sidbury towards his costs. Traversed Easter 1777. Bill found Easter 1777. Tried Easter 1777 and fined 1s on submission.

person: Honor Jennings of Ottery St. Mary Singlewoman

person: William Skinner of Ottery St. Mary
crime: No272/24 - 26th August 20 George 3 - For assaulting John Pine, clerk, one of His Majestys Justices of the Peace of the County of Devon and threatening, vilifying, and abusing and ill treating him. person: Walter Pulman of Ottery St. Mary Labourer

Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tried Easter 1783 - all three fined 1s each on submission.

person: Joseph Broadbeard alias Bradbeer of Ottery St. Mary Yeoman
crime: No28 - 3rd June 23 George 3 - For unmlawfully obstructing and stopping up a certain watercourse which runs from certain Mills called Holcumb Mills in and through part of the town of Ottery St. Mary. Bill found Midsummer 1783.

No93/1 - 15th April 1760 - For unlawfully having in his Custody one Iron Pump Burr val 1d; four Iron Spike nails val 3d; and one Iron Crow val 1d 1/2d; the parcell of the Naval Stores of our Lord the King. person: Samuel Picken Parish Constable of Plymstock
crime: No203/3 - 26th August 1765 - For not returning a List of Jurors. Traversed Xmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tried Easter 1767 - Not Guilty.

person: Grace Elliott w/o Robert Elliott of Plympton St. Mary Labourer
crime: No5 - 30th May 1767 - For stealing a parcell of wood val 10d the goods of William Harris, Gentleman. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tried Midsummer 1767 - Guilty val 2d - Whipped and Discharged.

person: Thomas scott of Plympton Maurice Labourer
crime: No110/6 - 23rd December 1768 - For stealing one Fine Muslin Gown val 10s; Two Callico Petticoats val 15s; and divers other goods of Isaac Ourry, esq, particularly mentioned. Tried Xmas 1769 - All to be whipped at Plympton on Thursday the 26th instant between 9 and 11 o'clock and then Discharged.

crime: No438/13 - 1st September 13 George 3 - For unlawfully refusing to provide for Rachell Horrell his parish Apprentice to the charge of the parish of Plympton Saint Mary of 10£. Traversed Easter 1775. Bill found Michaelmas 1774. Tried Midsummer 1775 - Guilty and fined 1s.

person: Elizabeth Keys of Plympton Maurice Spinster
crime: No14 - 22nd April 16 George 3 - For stealing one Cord purse val 2d; 4 Guineas and 4 shillings in money the goods and money of William Avent. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - Guilty val 10d Burnt in the Hand and Discharged. [comment] After she was convicted of the stealing and punished she gave evidence against Sarah Scobble].

crime: No15 - 22nd April 16 George 3 - For feloniously Receiving the said goods and moneys knowing them to be stolen. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Tried Midsummer 1776 - Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned in Bridewell for three years and kept to hard labour - [vide Act 16 George 3].
No16 - 2nd March 18 George 3 - For stealing a Game Cock val 4s the goods of John MacBride, esq. Traversed Easter 1778. Bill found Easter 1778. Tried Easter 1778 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

Tryed Xmas 1769 - [Ballamy] could not be tryed the Principal being only convicted of Petty Larceny - [Glover] - Guilty val 8d - whipped and sent by Pass to his Settlement.
