person: Ann Spriddle uxor of Henry Spriddle
crime: No289/230 - 20th July 21 George 3 - For assaulting William Freeborn an Officer of the Customs in the Execution of his Office and unlawfully Resisting opposing and hindering him from siezing Two Casks of Foreign Brandy contaning 9 Gallons each and three Casks of foreign Geneva containing nine Gallons each the same being unacustomed and liable to pay Duties which had never been paid. 2nd count - For rescuing the said Goods. 3rd Count - for endeavouring to Rescue the same. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tryed Epiphany 1782 - both found Not Guilty.

person: John Coombe of Stoke Damerall Blacksmith
crime: No291/232 - 5th September 21 George 3 - For unlawfully having in his custody, possession, and keeping, One iron Bolt val 1s, one iron Chissel val 3d, nine Iron Spike Nails val 9d, one Iron Staple val 1d, and 17 Small Iron Nails val 2d, of the Warlike and Naval Stores of our Lord the King, with three other counts. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tryed Epiphany 1781 - both Guilty and fined 20s each.

person: Richard Davis, esq, of Stoke Damerall
crime: No291/234 - 18th May 21 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Poole [Sheriffs Bailiff in the due Execution of his Office]. 2nd Count, Common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Epiphany 1781. Tryed Easter 1782 - Not Guilty.

person: Thomas Harris of Stoke Damerall Mariner
crime: No599/236 - 7th January 22 George 3 - For stealing Three pieces of Leather val 2s, the goods of our Sovereign Lord the King. 2nd Count - the goods of a person unknown. Also charged with stealing One Large Rope called a Cabelet val 4£ the goods of our Sovereign Lord the King. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tryed Epiphany 1782 - Not Guilty on the first charge. Guilty on the second charge val 10d - Imprisoned in Bridewell one Month and to pay a fine of 6s-8d.
No599/238 - 6th November 22 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Brener. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Traversed Easter 1782. Tryed Midsummer 1782 - Not Guilty.

person: Edward Locker of Stoke Damerall Victualler
crime: No599/239 - 29th November 22 George 3 - For unlawfully and obstinately Neglecting and refusing to execute a warrant granted by Ffrancis Gregor, esq, one of His Majesty's Justices of the peace for the County of Cornwall, and endorsed by James Young, esq, one of His Majesty's Justice of the Peace for the county of Devon, whereby he [as Constable of of the said parish of Stoke Damerall] was commanded to apprehend and take Thomas Dowrick for deserting and leaving his Family, whereby they became chargeable to the parish of Veryan in Cornwall aforesaid. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Traversed Easter 1782. Tryed Midsummer 1782 - Guilty fined Ten Pounds and Imprisoned till payed.

person: William Bryan of Stoke Damerall Labourer
crime: No605/240 - 3rd April 22 George 3 - For assaulting Grace uxor of David Bryan. Bill found Easter 1782. Traversed Easter 1782. Tryed Easter 1782 - Guilty fined 1d Imprisoned one hour and discharged having Inlisted.

person: William Burrow of Stoke Damerall Victualler
crime: No606/241 - 10th January 22 George 3 - For assaulting Ann uxor of William Chapman. Bill found Easter 1782.

person: Hannibal Earl Hawkins of Stoke Damerall Gentleman
crime: No606/242 - 11th March 22 George 3 - For assaulting John Fichley. Bill found Easter 1782. Traversed Easter 1782. Tryed Midsummer 1782 - fined 1s.

No606/243 - 24th April 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one buoy Rope in weight 100lbs one quarte, and 9oz, and in thickness 6 1/2 inches val 3s, one Luff Tackle and Two Blocks val 2s, two pieces of Rope of 24lb weight val 1s, and Three Fowls val 6d, the goods of the Honourable Samuel Barrington, esq, and others. Bill found Midsummer 1782. Traversed Midsummer 1782. Tryed Midsummer 1782 - Not Guilty.

person: Sarah Richards w/o said Zacariah Richards
crime: No284/245 - 31st August 22 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon Gregor Farquharson, esq. 2nd Count - common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782. Tryed Easter 1783 - All found Not Guilty, except Margaret Bateman who was fined 1d.

person: Richard Dingle of East Stonehouse Victualler
crime: No285/250 - 31st August 22 George 3 - For assaulting Donald Farquharson, Gentleman. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782.

person: Mary Dunn w/o said Thomas Dunn
crime: No286/252 - 7th August 22 George 3 - For assaulting James Mullens. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782. Tryed Epiphany 1783 - Not Guilty.

person: John Reed the younger of Buckland Monachorum Victualler
crime: No287/254 - 11th Septmber 22 George 3 - For assaulting John Chipping with a Reap Hook with an Intent to Kill and murder him. 2nd Count - common asault. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782.

person: John Squire, esq, of Stoke Damerall
crime: No287/255 - 31st August 22 George 3 - For assaulting William Rowland [then one of the Constables of the parish of East Stonehouse]. 2nd Count - common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782.
No287/257 - 1st August 22 George 3 - For assaulting John Harris. Bill found Michaelmas 1782.

person: John Jane of Stoke Damerall Labourer
crime: No287/260 - 9th September 22 George 3 - For assaulting Walter Symons. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Tryed Easter 1783 - fined 1s.

person: George Bone of Stoke Damerall Shipwright
crime: No287/261 - 14th December 23 George 3 - For assaulting Willioam Husband with a certain Hand Spike with an Intent to kill and Murder. 2nd Count - common assault. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Traversed Epiphany 1783.

person: Edward Hoskins of Stoke Damerall Labourer
crime: No287/262 - 4th January 23 George 3 - For assaulting Michael Ley. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Tryed Easter 1783 - fined 1s.

person: Maurice Fitzgerald, esq, Captain in the Irish Independants at Plymouth Dock
crime: No287/263 - 15th October 22 George 3 - For assaulting Richard Rows. Bill found Epiphany 1783.

person: Edward Laney of Stoke Damerall Mariner
crime: No287/264 - 2nd April 23 George 3 For feloniously stealing two pair of cloth Breeches val 3s, the goods of John Horwell. Bill found Easter 1783. Traversed Easter 1783. Tryed Easter 1783 - Guilty - Imprisoned one Month in Gaol and whipped twice.

person: George Adams of Stoke Damerall Inn Keeper
crime: No273.265 - 12th June 23 George 3 - For assaulting Joseph Gardiner [then being one of the Constables of the Parish of Stoke Damerall] in the due Execution of his office. 2nd Count - common assault. Bill found Midsummer 1783. Traversed Midsummer 1783.

person: Mary Adams w/o said George Adams of Stoke Damerall Innkeeper
crime: No273/266 - 12th June 23 George 3 - For assaulting Lewis Dennis Ward. Bill found Midsummer 1783. Traversed Midsummer 1783.

person: Guilliaume Maris Coquet of Stoke Damerall Gentleman
crime: No273/267 - 20th May 23 George 3 - For assaulting Henry Groube. Bill found Midsummer 1783. Traversed Midsummer 1783.

person: John Robertson of Stoke Damerall Labourer
crime: No273/268 - 19th June 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one pair of Black Worsted val 6d, one pair of Blue Stockings val 6d, and one pair of small ribbed mixture Worsted Stockings val, the goods of Edward Hutchins. Bill found Midsummer 1783. Traversed Midsummer 1783. Tryed Midsummer 1783 - Guilty val 9d - whipped and discharged.
No18/1 - 2nd October 1749 - For that being Constable of that Parish he did contemptuously refuse to return a list of Jurors. Bill found Midsummer 1750.

person: Richard Hanger of Martin [Qu Merton] Blacksmith
crime: No74/3 - 1st January 1757 - For unlawfully running from his family and leaving them chargeable to the parish. Bill found Michaelmas 1757.
No1/4 - 4th March 1758 - For assaulting George Cockram and Imprisoning him unlawfully for 12 Hours. Bill found Easter 1758.

No194/22 - 3rd October 1766 - For stealing part of a Rope called a Tackle Fall of thr eight of 24lbs val 5s the goods of John Shaxon. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tryed Michaelmas 1766 - Guilty val 6d - whipped and discharged.
No1/7- 2nd October 1766 - For stealing a Tackle Fall Rope val 1s the goods of John Shaxon. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tryed Michaelmas 1766 - Guilty val 6d - whipped and discharged.

person: James Pitts of Appledore within the parish of Northam Shipwright
crime: No87/8 - For assaulting Elizabeth Hughes widow. Traversed Easter 1767. Bill found Easter 1767. Tryed Midsummer 1767 - Not Guilty.
No87/9 - 11th June 1767 - For stealing one Canvas Shirt val 3s, the goods of Samuel Longman. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tryed Midsummer 1767 - Guilty val 1s - Transported for Seven Years.
No249/10 - 2nd July 1767 - For assaulting Pessy Pedorick. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tryed Easter 1768 - Not Guilty.

No270/12 - 5th October 1767 - For a nuisance by permitting the Hedges of a Close called the Four Acres belonging to him to remain uncutt and unpaired adjoining to the Highway in the said parish of Shebbear, whereby etc. Also charged - For a nuisance by stopping up an Ancient Gutter used for conveying the Rain from the Highway through the Hedge of a field called the Four Acres belonging to him in the parish of Shebbear whereby, etc. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tryed Xmas 1769 - fined 6d on each charge.

No277/14 - 20th December 1767 - For unlawfully threatening, terrifying, and Intimidating John Lee overseer of the poor of the parish of Shebbear from obeying a warrant granted by John Spooner, esq, for the relief of John Hobbs a poor boy of that parish. Also charged with assaulting John Hobbs. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tryed Midsummer 1768 - Guilty fined 1s/Not Guilty of assault on John Hobbs.

person: Thomas Brimacombe of Newton St. Petrock Labourer
crime: No279/16 - 20th November 1768 - For assaulting William Hockin junior. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tryed Easter 1768 - each fined 6d.
No283/19 - 4th March 1768 - For assaulting George Fortescue. Bill found Easter 1768. Tryed Midsummer 1769 - fined 6d.
No108/20 - 9th April 1768 - For stealing 2 Oak Trees val 20s ye goods of George Fortescue. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tryed Xmas 1769 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Michael Crang of Landcrass Labourer P.C.
crime: No294/21 - 29th September 1768 - For not returning a List of Jurors. Traversed Easter 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Midsummer 1769 - Not Guilty.

No294/22 - 23rd September 1768 - For stealing 2 Ducks val 8d, one Mallard val 1d, and one Hen val 4d, the goods of John Husband. Traversed Easter 1769. Bill found Easter 1769. Tryed Easter 1769 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No341/23 - 21st March 10 George 3 - For assaulting Abraham Spearman. Bill found Easter 1770. Tryed Midsummer 1770 - fined 6d.
No344/24 - 1st March 10 George 3 - For a nuisance by permnitting his Hedges to remain uncut, and not cleaning his Ditches and Gutters. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tryed Easter 1771 - fined 1s.

person: Zaccheus Lee of Buckland Brewer Labourer
crime: No344/25 - 1st November 11 George 3 - For stealing Four Pewter Plates val 10d the goods of John Davie, esq. Traversed Xmas 1771. Bill found Xmas 1771. Tryed Xmas 1771 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: John Paddon of Idesleigh Yeoman P.C.
crime: No370/26 - 5th September 11 George 3 - For not returning a list of Jurors. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tryed Epiphany 1773 - fined 1s.

person: John Hutchings of Peters Marland P.C.
crime: No371/27 - 6th September 11 George 3 - For not returning a list of Jurors. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tryed Michaelmas 1772 - fined 1s.
No411/28 - 10th May 13 George 3 - For assaulting Sarah Balson. Traversed Midsummer 1774. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tryed Michaelmas 1774 - Not Guilty.

No462/29 - 26th March 15 George 3 - For a forcible entry into an Overland Tenement called Furlongs and Broadparks in Shebbear and expelling Robert Collacott therefrom. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Bill found Midsummer 1775. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - each fined 1s.

person: William Blight of Buckland Brewer Labourer
crime: No465/33 - 6th April 15 George 3 - For Entering Injuriously into a Chamber there in possession of John Rowe and Expelling him therefrom. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Bill found Midsummer 1775. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - Spearman and Blight found Guilty and each fined 3s-4d; Lemman found Not Guilty.

No475/36 - 27th March 16 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon William Snelling a Sheriffs Bailiff in the Execution of his Office. 2nd Count - common assault. Bill found Easter 1776. Tryed Midsummer 1776 - all fined 1s each.

person: John Wills of Bideford Yeoman another Churchwarden
crime: No491/91 - 22nd July 16 George 3 - For unlawfully and contemptuously neglecting and Refusing to obey an order of Midsummer Sessions last whereby he and others were ordered to pay the Overseers of the Poor of the Parish of Bradford 3 Guineas costs and 5£-12s-0 1/2d for paupers maintenance on an Appeal. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tryed Easter 1777 - all fined 1s each.

No491/45 - 27th December 17 George 3 - For stealing 9 shillings; a sixpence and a Crown piece in silver, and one Gold Ring val 10s the goods and monies of James Vanstone. Traversed Epiphany 1777. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned 6 months in Bridewell and whipped at the Epiphany unless he Inlists.
No505/46 - 17th October 16 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Kelland there. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Tryed Midsummer 1777 - fined 6d.

No260/47 - 10th December 20 George 3 - For a Forcible Entry into a Messuage called Rouses in the parish of Cookbury and unlawfully Expelling and keeping out Richard Penhale from the possession thereof. 2nd Count - For an unlawful entry and carrying away a feather bed and divers other goods. Bill found Epiphany 1780. Traversed Epiphany 1780. Tryed Easter 1780 - both found Guilty - each fined 1 mark and committed to Bridewell for one Month.

No260/49 - 7th June 21 George 3 - For assaulting William Patridge and threatening to kill and murder him. Bill found Midsummer 1781. Traversed Midsummer 1781. Tryed Midsummer 1781 - both found Guilty - John Watkins imprisoned one week in Bridewell - Elizabeth Watkins Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell and her husband to give his security for her good behaviour for six months in 10£.

No260/51 - 10th September 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Blck Shalloon Petticoat val 5s the goods of Mary Lancey widow. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tryed Epiphany 1782 - Guilty val 3d Imprisoned 3 Months in Bridewell, whipped thrice and discharged.
No238/1 - 1st January 1767 - For keeping a common Alehouse not being Licensed. Bill found Easter 1767. Tryed Michaelmas 1767 - fined 1d.

No364/2 - 29th July 5 George 3 - from thence to - 10th April 11 George 3 - For assaulting John Hodge his Apprentice and cruel treating him whereby his feet and toes are entirely consumed, Perished and wasted away. 2nd Count - for a common assault. Bill found Midsummer 1771.

person: Elizabeth Rogers w/o Richard Rogers of Sherwill Labourer
crime: No364/5 - 25th June 13 George 3 - For unlawfully Silliciting, Inciting and persuading Eliabeth Rogers junior apprentice to George Hutchings to Imbezzle divers of his goods and monies and for knowingly and unlawfully receiving the same. Traversed Midsummer 1773. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tryed Midsummer 1773 - Guilty to be Imprisoned 12 Months in Bridewell.

person: Mary Hill w/o Christian Hill of Kentisbury Weaver
crime: No364/6 - 13th May 14 George 3 - For assaulting Richard Hooper. Traversed Midsummer 1774. Bill found Midsummer 1774. tryed Michaelmas 1774 - Not Guilty.

person: Daniel Nogle of Challacombe Rawleigh Husbandman
crime: No589/7 - 25th April 19 George 3 - For unlawfully receiving Lodging and Boarding 3 Female Bastard Children under the age of 9 years in his Dwelling House in the said Parish. Traversed Midsummer 1781. Bill found Easter 1781. Tryed Michaelmas 1781 - Quashed not being Indictable [vide Burrs Vol 3rd - 1645].

person: John Badcock junior of Southmolton Labourer
crime: No6/1 - 12th September 1746 - For assaulting John Thorne. Bill found Michaelmas 1746.

person: William Crang of Tawton Bishop Husbandman
crime: No25/4 - 29th March 1751 - For assaulting John Nott. Further charged with assaulting Christian the wife of Hugh Manley and rescuing 61 Sheep which she and one John Nott as [Sew...] to Jorcas Garde had lawfully distrained damage faisant. Bill found Easter 1751.

person: George Leworthy of Tawton Bishop Taylor
crime: No66/6 - 6th September 1765 - For assaulting Catherine Pugsley. Traversed Easter 1766. Bill found Easter 1766. Tryed Midsummer 1766 - fined 6d.

No232/7 - 25th April 1767 - For unlawfully fraudulently, and violently taking, seizing, acquiring, and getting into his hands, and possession 4 pewter Dishes val 12s, the goods of Nicholas Burgess under colour and pretence of a Distress for poor rates when none was in fact due. Traversed Midsummer 1767. Bill found Easter 1767. Tryed Michaelmas 1767 - Not Guilty.

No233/8 - 30th September 1766 - For the like offence in seizing one Brass Kettle val 9s, the goods of Nicholas Burgess as a Distress for Land Tax. Traversed Midsummer 1767. Bill found Easter 1767. Tryd Michaelmas 1767 - Not Guilty.

person: Ann Maddick w/o said Nathaniel Maddick
crime: No83/9 - 18th September 1767 - For stealing two Lawn Caps val 2s, one Holland Cap val 1s, and two yards of long Lawn val 5s, the goods of Agnes Dobb, Spinster. Traversed Michaelmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tryed Michaelmas 1767 - both Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Agnes Dobb of Bishops Tawton Spinster
crime: No84/11 - 15th September 1767 - For stealing one Pair of Lawn Ruffles val 6d, one piece of Catgut val 1s, one piece of Striped Lawn val 10d, and one Lawn Cap val 1s, the goods of Nathaniel Maddick. Traversed 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tryed Xmas 1768 - both found Guilty - whipped and discharged.

person: Grace Harris of Bishops Tawton Widow
crime: No85/13 - 15th September 1767 - For stealing one Snuff Box val 2d, Five Lawn Caps val 2s, three pair of Lawn Ruffles val 1s-6d, one Lawn Apron val 2s, one pair of Stays val 20s, and one pair of Cotton Gloves val 1s, the goods of Nathaniel Maddick. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tryed Xmas 1768 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Susanna Pike w/o said John Pike
crime: No255/14 - 25th August 1767 - For a Riot and Assault upon Chichester Incledon, Gentleman, at Bishops Tawton. 2nd Count, Common Assault. Traversed Michaelmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tryed Xmas 1768 - all fined 1d - except Nathaniel Maddick and his wife Ann who were both found Not Guilty.

person: William Snow of Bishops Tawton Cordwainer
crime: No263/26 - 17th August 1767 - For assaulting Nathaniel Maddick, and unlawfully breaking and entering his dwelling house in Bishops Tawton. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tryed Xmas 1768 - and all found Not Guilty.

person: Ann Maddick w/o said Nathaniel Maddick
crime: No263/31 - 15th September 1767 - For stealing one Blue Camblett Gown val 20s, and one Long Lawn Gown val 40s, the goods of Grace Harris widow. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tryed Xmas 1768 - both found Not Guilty nor did fly.

No263/33 - 6th May 1768 - For stealing two Guineas in Gold the monies of William Ley. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tryed Midsummer 1768 - Guilty val 6d - whipped and discharged.

No263/34 - 6th May 1768 - For feloniously receiving and having one Guinea of the above knowing it to have been stolen. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tryed Easter 1769 - Discharged as the Prisoner could not be tryed the Principal being only convicted of Petty Larceny.

person: John Hatch of Southmolton Parish Constable
crime: No263/35 - 29th September 1768 - For not returning a List of Jurors. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Xmas 1769 - fined 1d.

person: Elizabeth Oram w/o said Robert Oram
crime: No111/36 - 16th September 1768 - For stealing 7 Oak Rafters val 14s, one Oak Beam val 4s, and Twelve Dozen Pan Tiles val 8s, the Goods of George Leworthy. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Easter 1769 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: George Leworthy of Tawton Bishop Taylor
crime: No122/38 - 2nd December 1768 - For assaulting Elizabeth the wife of Robert Oram. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Easter 1769 - Not Guilty.

person: Simon Darch of Landkey Labourer Parish Constable
crime: No293/39 - 29th September 1768 - For not returning a List of Jurors. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Easter 1769 - fined 6d.
No297/40 - 10th January 1769 - For a Riot and Assault upon John Horne. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Easter 1769 - each fined 1d.
No306/43 - 14th November 1768 - For assaulting James Davey. Traversed Easter 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Midsummer 1769 - Shopland Guilty fined 1s - Baker Not Guilty.
No308/45 - For assaulting Samuel Lake. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Easter 1769 - fined 1d.

person: Joan Avery w/o said George Avery
crime: No123/46 - 17th March 1769 - For stealing one Spade or Handplough val 1s-6d the goods of Grace Mayne widow. Traversed Michaelmas 1769. Bill found Easter 176. Tryed Michaelmas 1769 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No326/48 - 1st October 7 George 3 - For unlawfully Erecting on the River Taw Mole and engine called a Reas for destroying fish and continuing the same to 1st October 8 George 3 whereby 50 Salmon, and 50 Trouts and the Spawn of 50 others were destroyed. Bill found Michaelmas 1769.
No336/49 - 1st October 8 George 3 - For the like offence - lain with 4 different counts. Traversed Midsummer 1770. Bill found Easter 1770. Tryed Michaelmas 1770 - Not Guilty.

No336/50 - 1st October 11 George 3 - For stealing one Linnen Bag val 8d, the goods of Humphry Mills. Traversed Michaelmas 1771. Bill found Michaelmas 1771. Tryed Michelmas 1771 - Guilty val 2d - Whipped and Imprisoned in Bridewell 3 months then to be whipped and Discharged.

person: William Featherstone Parish Constable of Bishopstawton
crime: No366/51 - 25th July 11 George 3 - For disobeying an Assize Process and unlawfully Imprisoning Agnes Dobb. Bill found Michaelmas 1771. Tryed Easter 1772 - fined 3s-4d.

person: John Pomery Constable of the Parish of East Anstey
crime: No387/52 - 1st September 12 George 3 - For not returning a List of Jurors. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tryed Midsummer 1773 - fined 1s.
No387/53 - 2nd April 13 George 3 - For assaulting Robert Brailey. Bill found Easter 1773. Tryed Easter 1773 - Fined 1d.
No387/54 - 27th March 13 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Bynon. Bill found Easter 1773. Tryed Easter 1773 - fined 6d.

No405/55 - 15th July 13 George 3 - For unlawfully Refusing to deliver three Cows distrained by him for Rent due to John Bowdon from Susanna Pearse as comanded by a warrant in Replovyn granted by John Sharland one of the Sheriffs Deputies. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tryed Easter 1774 - each fined 6d.

180/57 - 11th October 13 George 3 - For unlawfully obtaining from John Webber Junior one Guinea with an Intent to Defraud him thereof. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tryed Easter 1774 - fined 3s-4d.

person: Mary Ley w/o said Arthur Ley
crime: No180/58 - 20th September 14 George 3 - For stealing one Holland Shirt ye goods of Robert Upton. Traversed Michaelmas 1774. Bill found Michaelmas 1774. Tryed Michaelmas 1774 - Arthur Not Guilty nor did fly - Mary Guilty val 2d - To be Imprisoned 3 Months in Bridewell - whipped and discharged.

No472/60 - 14th August 15 George 3 - For assaulting John Tapp in Conveying a prisoner to Bridewell. 2nd Count - for a Common Assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - Mary Lake and Mary Mitchell each fined 6d.

No472/64 - 14th March 16 George 3 - For stealing one Dowlas Shift the goods of Mary Burgess. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Tryed Midsummer 1776 - Guilty val 11d - Whipped and Imprisoned in Bridewell for one Month.
No229/65 - 6th July 16 George 3 - For assaulting James Luxton. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Tryed Michaelmas 1776 - Not Guilty.

No229/66 - 7th September 18 George 3 - For assaulting Catherine[uxor Johis] Luxton and Feloniously attempting to Set Fire to his Dwelling House. Traversed Michaelmas 1778. Bill found Michaelmas 1778. Tryed Michaelmas 1778 - Not Guilty.
No268/67 - 4th July 20 George 3 - For assaulting Richard Nicholls. Traversed Midsummer 1780. Bill found Midsummer 1780. Tryed Michaelmas 1780 - fined 1s.

No267/68 - 13th November 21 George 3 - For assaulting Elizabeth the wife of Thomas Manning with an Intent ffeloniously to ravish her. 2nd Count - Common Assault. Traversed Epiphany 1781. Bill found Epiphany 1781. Tryed Easter 1781 - Not Guilty.

No267/69 - 10th June 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Canvas Shirt val 6d, and one Dowlas Shift with Holland Sleaves val 2s, the goods of Joan Tucker widow. Traversed Midsummer 1781. Bill found Midsummer 1781. Tryed Midsummer 1781 - Haydon Guilty val 2d Imprisoned 3 Months in Bridewell and whipped thrice - Westacott Not Guilty.

No267/71 - 2nd May 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealingTwo Cheeks of Pork val 1s and 10lb weight of Bacon val 1s the goods of Ann Southcombe widow. Traversed Midsummer 1782. Bill found Midsummer 1782. Tryed Midsummer 1782 - Guilty val 10d Imprisoned 6 Months in Bridewell and whipped once.

No267/72 - 25th March 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealingone Woolen Petticoat val 2s, the goods of the Churchwardens and Overseers of said parish. Traversed Michaelmas 1782. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Tryed Michaelmas 1782 - Not Guilty.

person: Grace Wilmits w/o Thomas Wilmits of Northmolton Labourer
crime: No267/73 - 13th May 23 George 3 - For milking one Quart of Milk from a cow belonging to John Mole and feloniously stealing and taking, and carrying away the same. Traversed Midsummer 1783. Bill found Midsummer 1783. Tryed Midsumkmer 1783 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No21/1 - 20th June 1750 - For unlawfully taking and carrying away 4£-10s-0d the moneys of William Johns. Bill found Midsummer 1750. [comment] Dead for several years.

person: Elizabeth Jeans w/o John Jeans of South Milton Yeoman
crime: No45/2 - 15th April 1765 - For assaulting Elizabeth Adams Spinster. Traversed Michaelmas 1765. Bill found Easter 1765. Tryed Xmas 1767 - Not Guilty.
No52/3 - 14th December 1765 - For stealing one piece of Oak val 8s, the goods of Joseph Lambell. Bill found Xmas 1766.

person: Walter Mitchell of South Brent Labourer
crime: No52/4 - 1st January 1766 - For stealing one Plough Share val 2s, one Harrow Tang val 4d, one Leather Horse Collar val 1s-6d, one single Plough Whipper val 6d, and one Plough val 2s, the goods of William Westbrook. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tryed Michaelmas 1766 - Not Guilty.
No214/5 - 19th September 1766 - For assaulting William Bear. Bill found Michaelmas 1766. Tryed Xmas 1767 - fined 1d.

person: Francis Cooke alias old Frank of Kingsbridge Cordwainer
crime: No214/6 - 12th July 1767 - For stealing Two Pair of Worsted Stockings val 2s, the goods of Nicholas Phillipps. Traversed Michaelmas 1767. Bill found Michaelmas 1767 - Guilty val 10d - whipped and discharged.

person: Francis Lark of West Alvington Cordwainer
crime: No214/7 - 9th February 1768 - For assaulting Agnes his wife. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Easter 1768. Tryed Easter 1768 - Guilty To pay a fine of 6d, and to be imprisoned till he finds security for his good behaviour for 6 months. Himself in 20£ and two sureties in 10£ each.

No287/8 - 31st May 1768 - For pulling down and destroying an Ancient Bridge called Skinners alias Vorda Bridge in Dartington. Bill found Midsummer 1768. [comment] Michaelmas 1768 Quashed on the motion of the Prosecution.

person: Timothy Thuill of South Brent Labourer
crime: No310/9 - 19th September 1768 - For not returning a list of Jurors. Traversed Michaelmas 1769. Bill found Easter 1769. Tryed Xmas 1770 - fined 6d.
No348/10 - 25th July 10 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon James Roope junior. Bill found Michaelmas 1770. Tryed Midsummer 1771 - each fined 1s.

Traversed Easter 1771. Bill found Easter 1771.l Tryed Easter 1771 - Guilty val 6d - Transported for Seven Years.

No348/15 - 9th April 12 George 3 - For stealing one Drawing Knife val 1s-4d the goods of Roger Elliot. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tryed Easter 1772 - Guilty val 10d - whipped and discharged.

No348/16 - 4th April 12 George 3 - For stealing 2000 pins val 10d, five lbs weight of Lump Sugar val 3s, and divers other goods of John Roope. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tryed Easter 1772 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: James Webber of South Brent Labourer
crime: No348/17 - 28th November 13 George 3 - For stealing one broad cloth Coat val 10s, and one Thickset Waistcoat val 2s, the goods of Joseph Earl. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tryed Epiphany 1773 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Elizabeth Tozer uxor Johis Tozer of Moreleigh Labourer
crime: No406/18 - 17th January 13 George 3 - For conspiring to burthen the parish of moreleigh with the maintenance of one Ruth Tope and her child, in doing which they expended 20£ from the 31 day of May 13 George 3. Traversed Michaelmas 1773. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tryed Epiphany 1774 - all Not Guilty.

person: Grace Freeman of East Alvington Singlewoman
crime: No406/19 - 23rd August 13 George 3 - For assaulting Mary the wife of Nicholas Stone. Traversed Michaelmas 1773. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tryed Michaelmas 1773 - Guilty Imprisoned in Bridewell for three months.

No434/20 - 13th April 14 George 3 - For unlawfully absenting himself and not performing his duty as a Grand Juryman after being sworn at Easter. Bill found Midsummer 1774. Tryed Easter 1775 - fined 1s.

No434/21 - 18th March 15 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting his Child ad Dampn, etc, 2£-16s-0d. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tryed Michaelmas 1775 - Imprisoned 6 Months in Bridewell and whipped twice.

person: Thomas Luscombe of South Brent Labourer
crime: No434/22 - 18th November 17 George 3 - For stealing one Iron Plough Chain val 3s, six Iron Harrow Tangs val 2s, and one Iron Harrow Draught val 4s the goods of Timothy Thuell. 2nd Count - Ignot. Traversed Epiphany 1777 Bill found Epiphany 1777. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - Guilty val 11d - imprisoned 3 years in Bridewell under the late Convict Act with liberty to Inlist.

person: Michael Mudge of South Brent Cordwainer
crime: No232/23 - 8th February 17 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one old Gander val 5s, one Hen Turkey val 5s, the goods of Edmund Bowers. Bill found Midsummer 1777. [comment] He dyed in Bridewell about a fortnight after Midsummer Sessions 1777.

person: Mariam alias Meredith Abell of Buckfastleigh Singlewoman
crime: No232/25 - 1st September 18 George 3 - For feloniously stealing Two Cheque Aprons, one Dowlas Shift, and divers other goods of Philip Hayman. Bill found Michaelmas 1778. Tryed Michaelmas 1778 - Guilty val 10d on both charges - Imprisoned one month in Bridewell and whipped once.
No244/26 - 1st October 18 George 3 - For assaulting Edmund Roope. Traversed Epiphany 1779. Bill found Michaelmas 1778. Tryed Michaelmas 1779 - all found Not Guilty.
No574/35 - 12th May 20 George 3 - For assaulting John Dolbeare. Traversed Michaelmas 1780. Bill found Midsummer 1780. Tryed Easter 1781 - fined 1s.
No271/36 - 5th March 21 George 3 - For assaulting John Perring. Traversed Easter 1781. Bill found Easter 1781. Tryed Midsummer 1781 - Not Guilty.

No271/37 - 9th April 22 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Serge Petticoat val 4s-6d, one Green Cloak val 2s-6d, one pair of womans Leather Shoes val 3s, and one Straw Hat val 2s, the goods of Roger Bond. Traversed Midsummer 1782. Bill found Midsummer 1782. Tryed Midsummer 1782 - Guilty val 4d - whipped and Imprisoned three months in Bridewell.

person: Nicholas Moore of East Allington Mason
crime: No271/38 - 12th May 22 George 3 - For assaulting Ann Wee4ks widow. Traversed Midsummer 1782. Bill found Midsummer 1782. Tryed Midsummer 1782 - Guilty whipped twice and Imprisoned 12 months in Bridewell.

No68/1 - 2nd May 1766 - For stealing 1 Dowlas Shirt val 2s; one Holland Pillow Case val 6d; One Check Apron val 6d; and 1 Check Handkerchief val 6d; the Goods of John Pengelly. Traversed Midsummer 1766. Bill found Midsummer 1766. Tryed Midsummer 1766 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No68/2 - 2nd January 1768 - For stealing one Iron Plough Chain val 2s; the goods of George Edgecombe, Gentleman. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tryed Xmas 1768 - Guilty val 6d - Wjipped and Discharged.
No68/3 - 1st March 1768 - For assaulting Nicholas Hine. Bill found Easter 1768. Tryed Easter 1768 - fined 1d.
No68/4 - 26th December 12 George 3 - For stealing one Cock val 1s; the goods of Roger Bayley. Traversed Xmas 1772. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tryed Xmas 1772 - Guilty Transported for Seven Years.

No380/5 - 28th May 12 George 3 - For letting down the Fences of Kings Meadow and Cakes Meadow adjoining to Wilminstone Comon and Impounding Two Brown Steers of William Blanchards. Bill found Midsummer 1772. Tryed Michaelmas 1772 - fined 1s.

No380/6 - 1st April 14 George 3 - For stealing two Lead Weights of the weight of 20lbs val 1s-8d; the goods of the Dutchess of Bedford, Duke and Dutchess of Marlborough, and Robert Palmer, esquire. 2nd Count - ye goods of a person unknown. Traversed Easter 1774. Bill found Easter 1774. Tryed Easter 1774 - Guilty val 8d - Imprisoned for one Month, whipped once and Discharged.

No380/7 - 1st August 15 George 3 - For stealing two Geese val 2s; the goods of John Courtice. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tryed Michaelmas 1775 - Guilty - Imprisoned 3 Months in Bridewell and whipped once.

No380/8 - 21st October 15 George 3 - For Feloniously stealing 50lb weight of Iron val 5s; and 150lb weight of Lead val 10s; the Goods and Chattels of the mostnoble Gertrude, Dutchess of Bedford, the most noble Caroline, Dutchess of Marlborough, and Robert Palmer, esquire. 2nd Count - Goods and Chattels of a person unknown. [comment] Nb. the Duke of Marlborough not mentioned. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - both found Not Guilty nor did fly.

No380/10 - 24th October 15 George 3 - For Feloniously Receiving the said last mentioned Goods and Chattells knowing the same to have been stolen. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Not put upon his Tryal the principal ffelons being acquitted.

No380/11 - 1st August 20 George 3 - For Feloniously Stealing one pair of Cloth Breeches val 6d, and 1 pair of Yarn Stockings val 3d; the Goods of James Sanders. Traversed Michaelmas 1780. Bill found Michaelmas 1780. Tryed Michaelmas 1780 - Guilty val 3d - whipped and discharged.

person: James Smale of Bovey Tracey Yeoman
crime: No2/1 - 1st October 1745 - For unlawfully taking and Carrying away 3 Black Cocks and 1 Black Grey Cock and 4 Peck of Winnowed Wheat val in all 3s-4d the property of Henry Melhuish. Bill found Michaelmas 1745.

crime: No15/2 - 23rd April 1750 - For Assaulting Sarah Miller. Bill found Easter 1750.

No317/40 - 29th September 1769 - For Imbezzling 2lb of Worsted Wool from John Mardon. Bill found Easter 1769. Tryed Midsummer 1769 - fined 6d.

crime: No375/55 - 30th August 11 George 3 - For assaulting Robert Hannaford. Bill found Xmas 1772.

crime: No430/62 - 24th March 14 George 3 - For assaulting Ann the wife of Richard Avery. Traversed Midsummer 1774. Bill found Easter 1774. Tryed Michaelmas 1774 - fined 1s.

crime: No430/63 - 14th August 12 George 3 - For unlawfully refusing to obey an order in Bastardy. Bill found Easter 1775. Tryed Easter 1775 - To be imprisoned till he finds security to perform the order.

crime: No501/79 - 22nd June 17 George 3 - For stealing 15 Cabbage Plants val 5s out of the Garden of Sarah Wreyfoird widow - con form stat [6 George 3]. Bill found Midsummer 1777. Traversed Midsummer 1777. tryed Midsummer 1777 - Guilty val 11d - No judgement being under 5s value.

No607/107 - 30th September 22 George 3 - For assaulting Joseph Gribble. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782. Tryed Michaelmas 1782 - Guilty Imprisoned Six Months in Bridewell.

crime: No607/108 - 10th October 22 George 3 - For assaulting John Buckingham. Bill found Epiphany 1783.

Bill found Easter 1783. Traversed Easter 1783. Tryed Easter 1783 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No607/110 - 11th December 23 George 3 - For unlawfully obtaining from Elizabeth Boter the sum of four pence under false pretences. Bill found Easter 1783.

Traversed Michaelmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tryed Michaelmas 1768 - Guilty val 10d - Transported for Seven Years.
No155/17 - 29th May 10 George 3 - For stealing one Brass Pan val 10d, the goods of John Lee. Bill found Midsummer 1770.

No414/18 - 30th August 13 George 3 - For a forcible Entry into 5/8th parts of a Messuage with the Appurtenances called Pall House in Tiverton and expelling James Gribble from the Possession thereof. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. [John Drewe] Tryed Michaelmas 1774 - found Guilty and Fined 20s, and to give his own Security in 80£ for his good behaviour for Six Months. [Peter Chamberlin] Tryed Midsummer 1774 - found Guilty and fined 6d. [Further comment] - A special plea to the jurisdiction on behalf of Nine of the Defendants was received and filed at Epiphany Sessions 1776 - to which Plea there was a general Demurrer, advised and drawn by Mr. F. Buller and defendants - Joined in Demurrer, as of Epiphany Sessions 1776. At Easter Sessions 1776 the Demurrer was argued - when Judgement was given for the Prosecution and the Plea adjudged Bad, and the Defendants ordered to answer. Afterwards Removed by Certiorari.

No417/32 - 23rd November 14 George 3 - For a forcible Entry into 5/8th Parts of a Messuage with the Appurtenances called Pall House in Tiverton and expelling James Gribble from the possession thereof. Bill found Epiphany 1774 - [comment] afterwards plea to the Judiciary of the Court was rescinded and ordered to be filed at Epiphany Sessions 1776 on behalf of 4 defendants - Rossiter, Hatsell, Margaret Rossiter, Finch. The other proceeding as previous.

No417/38 - 5th April 15 George 3 - For stealing one Cock val 1s the goods of John Wadling. Traversed Easter 1775. Bill found Easter 1775. Tryed Easter 1775 - Guilty - Imprisoned in Bridewell for two months, whipped twice and discharged.

Bill found Easter 1767. Tryed Michaelmas 1767 - fined 1d.

No247/59 - 14th July 1767 - For a forcible entry into 3 closes of Land called Holmores Well, the Little Close, and the Orchard in the parish of Pinhoe in the possession of Joseph Carter. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tryed Easter 1768 - each fined 1d.

person: Thomas Elson alias Elston of Whitstone Labourer
crime: No248/65 - 3rd July 1767 - For a nuisance in keeping 3 Swine Hogs unyolked and unringed and so suffering them to go and stray. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tryed Michaelmas 1767 - fined 1d.
No262/66 - 1st March 1766 - For Imbezzling 18lb weight of wool the property of James Dodd. Bill found Michaelmas 1767.

person: Mary Blatchford w/o Edward Blatchford of Drewsteignton Labourer
crime: No267/67 - 10th December 1766 - For Imbezzling 36lb weight of Obb Wool ye property of Thomas Puddicombe. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tryed Midsummer 1769 - each fined 1d.

person: Samuel Badcocke of St Thomas the Apostle Mason
crime: No267/69 - 31st December 1767 - For assaulting Henry Adam and breaking and destroying a Window Leaf of his dwelling house. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tryed Xmas 1768 - Not Guilty.

No267/70 - 19th March 1768 - For stealing Four Quarts of Milk the goods of Philip Newcourt val 6d. Further charged with stealing 3 Quarts of Milk val 4d the goods of William Sargent. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Easter 1768. Tryed Easter 1768 - [comment] the prisoners were not tryed on count being convicted on the second indictment and punished. [for the second offence] both were found Guilty - whipped and discharged.

person: Elizabeth Tucker of St Thomas the Apostle widow
crime: No96/72 - 1st March 1768 - For unlawfully receiving a quantity of Coal val 2d from Sarah Steens the goods of Thomas Dingle, and which was Imbezzled from him at the Defendants solicitation. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Easter 1768. Tryed Midsummer 1768 - fined 6d.

No96/73 - 1st January 1768 - For stealing one Peck of Wheat val 1s-6d, one Peck of Horse Beans val 9d, one Peck of Oats val 4d, and one Peck of Peas val 1s, the goods of Matthew Trood. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tryed Midsummer 1768 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Robert Chown of Whipton in Heavitree Butcher
crime: No124/74 - 8th July 1768 - For a nuisance by leaving a great Quantity of Dung, human Excrements and filth in the Highway called Withy Bridge Turnpike Road. Traversed Midsummer 1768. Bill found Midsummer 1768. Tryed Michaelmas 1768 - Guilty and fined 1s.

No301/75 - 7th August 1768 - For receiving a Black Mare impounded by William Sprague for damage faisant from and out of the Custody of Thomas Ratcliffe the Keeper of the Mannor Pound of Rew. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Michaelmas 1768. Tryed Midsummer 1769 - Not Guilty.

person: John Blanchford junior alias Allen of Hittesleigh Labourer
crime: No301/76 - 16th April 1768 - For stealing 25 yards of White Serge val 20s the goods of John Welsford. Also charged with stealing 2 Canvas Sheets val 4s, two Dowlas Shirts val 5s, and one pair of White Cotton Stockings val 1s, the goods of William Anstey. Further charged with stealing one Holland Shift val 5s, the goods of Samuel Haine. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Xmas 1769 - Mary found Not Guilty - John [senior] and John [junior] bot found Guilty val 1s and Transported for Seven years.

No301/79 - 23rd March 1768 - For stealing 23 yards of white serge val 18sm the goods of Roger Wolsford. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Xmas 1769 - Guilty val 11d - Transported for Seven Years.

person: James Murphy pf St Thomas the Apostle Labourer
crime: No301/80 - 29th October 1768 - For stealing 2 Pecks of potatoes val 1s, the goods of James Clark. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Xmas 1769 - to be Imprisoned for 6 Months in Gaol and to find security for their good behaviour for 2 years after.

person: Elizabeth Wills w/o John Wills of St Thomas the Apostle Blacksmith
crime: No119/82 - 26th October 1768 - For unlawfully receiving 20 yards of Duroy Serge the goods of Daniel Collier which had been stolen by some person unknown. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Easter 1769 - Not Guilty.
No121/83 - 27th December 1768 - For assaulting Thomas Back. Traversed Xmas 1769. Bill found Xmas 1769. Tryed Easter 1769 - both fined 6d.

person: Thomazine Northcott uxor Richard Northcott of Throwley Labourer
crime: No302/85 - 1st May 1768 - For Imbezzling 12lb weight of Obb wool the goods of Edward Leach. Traversed Easter 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tryed Easter 1768 - Not Guilty.

person: Mary Linthorn uxor Richard Linthorn of Southtawton Mason
crime: No303/86 - 1st May 1768 - For Imbezzling 11lb weight Obb wool the goods of Edward Leach. Bill found Xmas 1769.

person: Thomas Squarrey of St Nicholas Mariner
crime: No315/87 - 4th April 1769 - For assaulting John Champion. Bill found Easter 1769. Tryed Midsummer 1769 - fined 6d.
No316/88 - 29th September 1768 - For Imbezzling 10lb of Wool ye goods of John Mardon. Bill found Easter 1769. Tryed Midsummer 1769 - fined 1d.

No320/89 - 6th April 1769 - For unlawfully cutting down, rooting up, and destroying 30 ffaggotts of Oak Wood val 50s the goods of John Mortimore. Traversed Michaelmas 1769. Bill found Easter 1769. Tryed Michalmas 1769 - Connett fined 6d - May proved to be dead at Easter 1771.

person: Frederick Lapentiere of St Thomas the Apostle Labourer
crime: No321/91 - 12th July 1769 - For assaulting Mary Geere. Bill found Midsummer 1769. Tryed Xmas 1770 fined 6d.

No134/92 - 14th July 9 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon William Gillard Petty Constable of that Parish in the Execution of his office. 2nd Count - for a common assault. Traversed Michaelmas 1769. Bill found Michaelmas 1769. Tryed Xmas 1770 - each fined 6d.

No323/95 - 15th September 1769 - For rescuing a Calf val 1£-3s-0d Distrained by Robert Norrish for rent due to Robert Smith. Traversed Xmas 1770. Bill found Michaelmas 1769. Tryed Xmas 1770 - Not Guilty.

No329/96 - 15th September 9 George 3 - For assaulting Ann the wife of William Moxey and forcibly and unlawfully breaking and entering her Dwelling House. Bill found Michaelmas 1769. Tryed Xmas 1770 - Imprisoned for three days and fined 1s.

No32/97 - 1st May 8 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting his wife and two Children and leaving then to the charge of the parish who have expended 8£. Bill found Xmas 1770. Tryed Xmas 1770 - Whipped and Imprisoned till he finds security for 12 months.

No329/98 - 2nd January 10 George 3 - For feloniously receiving and having one Dragg with the Iron Tings val 5s, the goods of John Martin before stolen by John Stephens, knowing them to be stolen. Traversed Midsummer 1770. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tryed Midsummer 1770 - Not Guilty - [The principal felon being Acquitted].

No346/99 - 30th March 10 George 3 - For unlawfully Breaking and Entering the Dwelling House and Garden of Margaret Mitchell, Singlewoman in Pinhoe, and forcibly taking and carrying away divers of her Goods and Chattells of the value £6. Traversed Michaelmas 1770. Bill found Midsummer 1770. Tryed Xmas 1771 - Not Guilty.

person: Mary Northcott w.o Richard Northcott junior of Throwleigh
crime: No347/100 - 2nd January 9 George 3 - For Imbezzling 12lb Weight of Obb Wool the property of Edward Leach. Bill found Midsummer 1770.
No350/101 - 15th September 10 George 3 - For assaulting William Gouldsworthy. Bill found Michaelmas 1770. Tryed Easter 1771 - fined 1£.
No350/102 - 3rd November 11 George 3 - For assaulting Elizabeth Coombe. Bill found Xmas 1771. Tryed Xmas 1771 - both fined 3s-4d.

No163/104 - 6th October 10 George 3 - For stealing 3lb weight of Tallow val 1s, and 20lb weight of Mutton val 5s, the goods of Joseph Hore. 2nd Count - for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Midsummer 1775. Bill found Xmas 1771. Tryed Midsummer 1775 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No163/105 - 11th January 11 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting his wife and 2 Children and leaving them to the Charge of the Parish 3£. Bill found Midsummer 1771. Tryed Midsummer 1771 - Whipped and Discharged.

No359/106 - 10th July 11 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon Grace the wife of Joseph Woolacot at the parish of Kenn. Also charged for a Riot and Assault upon Emmanuel Hutchings. Bill found Midsummer 1771. Tryed Michaelmas 1771 - fined 6d on each charge.

No257/108 - 8th August 11 George 3 - For unlawfully Solliciting Sarah Manley Apprentice to Thomas Heard to imbezzle her Masters goods and receiving one peck of meal val 1s-6d, one lb of Bacon val 6d, knowing it to have been so Imbezzled. Traversed Easter 1779. Bill found Michaelmas 1771. Tryed Midsummer 1779 - John/Elizabeth Ford Not Guilty - Henrietta Ford - dead in America.

person: Mary Hatchell of East Ogwell Singlewoman
crime: No370/111 - 24th June 11 George 3 - For assaulting John Perryman junior. Bill found Michaelmas 1772. Tryed Xmas 1772 - both fined 1s.

person: Nicholas Eales alias Ellis of Chagford Yeoman
crime: No376/113 - 1st May 10 George 3 - For assaulting William Strike. Traversed Michaelmas 1772. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tryed Epiphany 1773 - Guilty fined 1£-1s-0d and to be Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell.

No376/114 - 5th April 12 George 3 - For stealing 3 Pecks of Barley val 2s, two Pecks of Potatoes val 1s; one Peck Wheat Flour val 1s; and one Mallard val 1s; the goods of the Reverend John Southmead. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tryed Easter 1772 - Guilty val 10d - Transported for Seven Years.

person: Robert Flood of Stoke Cannon Cordwainer
crime: No376/115 - 25th April 12 George 3 - For assaulting Mary the wife of John Mills. Traversed Easter 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tryed Easter 1772 - Guilty fined 6s-8d Imprisoned 3 months in Gaol and to find security for 12 Months.

No170/116 - 4th April 12 George 3 - For stealing 4lb weight of Wheat fflour val 6d, and six Quarts of Cyder val 1s, the goods of John Ocock. Traversed Midsummer 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tryed Midsummer 1772 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Jophn Galliping of St Thomas the Apostle Sergeweaver
crime: No171/117 - 23rd April 12 George 3 - For stealing 12 bushels of Wheat of the val of 3£-18s-0d the goods of William Harris. Traversed Michaelmas 1772. Bill found Easter 1772. Tryed Michaelmas 1772 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No382/118 - 21st September 12 George 3 - For unlawfully receiving Jane Silvester, Singlewoman into his family being big with Child of a Bastard and intent to Burthen the parish. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Michaelmas 1772. Tryed Epiphany 1773 - Not Guilty.

No382/119 - 18th October 12 George 3 - For stealing one Whicker Basketval 6d, 1 Case Knife val 3d, and divers other goods of John Fish. Traversed Epiphany 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tryed Epiphany 1773 - Guilty val 6d Whipped and Discharged.

No391/120 - 6th November 13 George 3 - For unlawfully receiving Ann Johns to Lodge in his Cottage where she was delivered of a Male Bastard Child. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tryed Michaelmas 1773 - fined 1d.
No395/121 - 29th September 12 George 3 - For Imbezzling 19lb of Obb Wool delivered to her by Robert Browne to be spun into yarn and then returned. Bill found Epiphany 1773.
No400/122 - 20th November 13 George 3 - For Imbezzling 12lb weight of Obb Wool of Susanna Varder. Bill found Easter 1773. Tryed Michaelmas 1775 - fined 1d.
No401/123 - 14th October 12 George 3 - For Imbezzling 18lb weight of Obb Wool of Susanna Varder. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Bill found Easter 1773. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - fined 1d.
No402/124 - 6th October 12 George 3 - For Imbezzling 14lb weight of Obb Wool of Thomas Partridge. Bill found Easter 1773.

No403/125 - 7th January 13 George 3 - For a Nuisance in leaving a Well unfenced in the Common Highway to the imminent Danger of the Lives of Passengers. Bill found Easter 1773. Tryed Michaelmas 1774 - fined 1s.

person: Ann Ellis w/o John Ellis of Chagford Labourer
crime: No179/126 - 21st May 13 George 3 - For stealing a Canvas Shift val 1s, the goods of Richard Walrond. Traversed Michaelmas 1773. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tryed Michaelmas 1773 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No179/127 - 28th August 13 George 3 - For assaulting Joan Wonson widow. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tryed Michaelmas 1773 - fined 1s.
No179/185 - 9th September 13 George 3 - For assaulting Elianor Beirth his wife. Traversed Michaelmas 1773. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tryed Epiphany 1774 - fined 3s-4d.

No415/186 - 28th September 13 George 3 - For assaulting Joan Bidgood a Collector of the Turnpike Tolls in the Execution of her Office. 2nd Count - common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1773. Tryed Easter 1774 - Imprisoned one Month and fined 6d.

person: Mary Welch w/o Robert Welch of Rewe Yeoman
crime: No184/187 - 18th October 13 George 3 - For assaulting Nance the wife of James Savery with an Intent to Murder her with a Pitchfork. 2nd Count - for a common assault. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tryed Easter 1774 - Not Guilty.
No421/188 - 17th December 12 George 3 - For unjustly Imbezzling 16lb weight of Obb Wool of one John Battishill. Bill found Epiphany 1774.

person: Robert Ellston of St Thomas the Apostle Butcher
crime: No422/189 - 14th December 14 George 3 - For assaulting John Endacott. Also charged on 31st May 13 George 3 For assaulting John Jutsam. Bills found Epiphany 1774. Tryed Easter 1774 - fined 1s.

person: Elizabeth Sitter of Cheriton Bishop Singlewoman
crime: No426/191 - 1st April 12 George 3 - For unlawfully Imbezzling 11lb weight of Worsted Wool of John Marden. Traversed Midsummer 1774. Bill found Easter 1774. Tryed Michaelmas 1774 - fined 1d.

crime: No427/192 - 19th April 13 George 3 - For Imbezzling 6lb Worsted Wool of John Maren. Bill found Easter 1774. Tryed Midsummer 1774 - fined 6d.

crime: No427/193 - 15th June 14 George 3 - For assaulting Anne Brookes. Bill found Midsummer 1774. Tryed Midsummer 1774 - fined 2s-6d.

No186/194 - 14th July 14 George 3 - For stealing 20 Horse Seams of Hay val 4£ the goods of Peter Berlon. Traversed Michaelmas 1774. Bill found Midsummer 1774. Tryed Michaelmas 1774 - Not Guilty nor did fly.
No437/196 - 12th July 14 George 3 - For assaulting William Seward. Traversed Michaelmas 1774. Bill found Midsummer 1774. Tryed Epiphany 1775 - Not Guilty.
No439/197 - 8th August 14 George 3 - For assaulting John Gotham. Bill found Michaelmas 1774. Tryed Epiphany 1775 - fined 6d.
No441/198 - 29th August 14 George 3 - For assaulting James Cooke. Bill found Michaelmas 1774. Tryed Epiphany 1775 - each fined 6d.

No195/200 - 8th December 15 George 3 - For stealing 3 Pecks of Wheat val 6s, the goods of Robert Foss. 2nd Count - ye goods of a person unknown. Bill found Epiphany 1775. Tryed Easter 1775 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No195/201 - 25th September 15 George 3 - For stealing two Pecks of Wheat of William Earland at Cheriton Bishop. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - Guilty val 10d imprisoned 3 Months in Bridewell and whipped twice.

person: Henry Clarke of Cheriton Bishop Butcher
crime: No480/202 - 23rd December 16 George 3 - For fraudulently selling to John Sweet 20lb Weight Hogs ffat as and for good Tallow and thereby defrauding him of 6s-3d. Bill found Epiphany 1776. Tryed Easter 1776 - fined 1d.

No480/203 - 20th January 16 George 3 - For stealing one piece of Oakwood val 4d and two pieces of Birchwood val 2d, the goods of John Bellamy. Traversed Easter 1776. Bill found Easter 1776. Tryed Easter 1776 - Guilty Imprisoned one Month whipped twice and discharged.

person: Jane Hayne uxor William Hayne of St Thomas the Apostle Gardiner
crime: No480/204 - 1st February 16 George 3 - For assaulting Charles Spiring. Bill found Easter 1776. Tryed Easter 1776 - Imprisoned for a week.
No226/205 - 1st January 16 George 3 - For stealiong one Musket val 2s the goods of George Cann. Traversed Epiphany 1777. Bill found Easter 1776. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Elizabeth Glanville uxor - Glanville of South Tawton Mason
crime: No481/206 - 1st November 16 George 3 - For Imbezzling 9lb of Wool of James Dodd. Bill found Easter 1776.

person: Edward Daniel of Heavitree Button Maker
crime: No481/207 - 2nd May 16 George 3 - For assaulting Charles Salisbury. Bill found Midsummer 1776. Tryed Midsummer 1776 - fined 1d.

person: philip Hitchins of Upton Pyne Labourer
crime: No481/208 - 13th June 16 George 3 - For assaulting George Rudale. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. tryed Midsummer 1776 - Guilty fined 1s and Imprisoned two Months in Bridewell.

person: Mary Mills w/o John Mills of Stoke Cannon Blacksmith
crime: No481/209 - 2nd May 16 George 3 - For assaulting Elizabeth Mitch. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Midsummer 1776. tryed Midsujmmer 1776 - Not Guilty.

person: Turpin Turner of Stoke Cannon Labourer
crime: No494/210 - 5th October 16 George 3 - For unlawfully Rescuing 4 Piggs of Richard Coles distrained by Joseph Carter for Damage Faisant. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - both fined 6d.

person: Richard Coles of Stoke Cannon Yeomanersed
crime: No494/212 - 5th October 16 George 3 - For assaulting Joseph Carter. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. tryed Epiphany 1777 - fined 6d.

No494/213 - 1st April 16 George 3 - For stealing two Guineas in money of Elizabeth Burnell widow. 2nd Count - Ignet. Traversed Epiphany 1777. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - Guilty val 10d - Imprisoned 3 Months in Bridewell, whipped twice and discharged.

No494/214 - 1st May 16 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting her Female Bastard Child and leaving it to the Parish. Traversed Epiphany 1777. Bill found Epiphany 1777. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - Guilty - Imprisoned 12 Months in Bridewell and whipped twice.

person: Thomas Webber of Upton Pyne Yeoman
crime: No497/215 - 6 January 17 George 3 - For a forcible entry into a Messuage in Crediton and Expelling William Browne from the possession thereof and for unlawfully entering his Messuage there and expelling him therefrom and for forcibly taking and converting to his own use divers of the said William Browne's Goods to wit a working Table, oil and Jarrs and a Quantity of Pitch. Traversed Easter 1777. Bill found Epiphany 1777. tryed Midsummer 1777 - both Guilty and fined 1s each.

No508/217 - 24th June 17 George 3 - For assaulting James Bryant and Thomas Coleman and unlawfully rescuig himself out of their custody under a Justices Warrant for Bankruptcy. Bill found Midsummer 1777.

person: Elizabeth Glanvill uxor Richard Glanvill of Southtawton Labourer
crime: No513/218 - 12th February 17 George 3 - For Imbezzling 12lb weight of Obb Wool of Elizabeth Bidgood widow. Bill found Midsummer 1777.

person: William Norton of St. Thomas the Apostle Bricklayer
crime: No513/219 - 8th September 17 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting his wife and 3 Children - 15s. Traversed Michaelmas 1777. Bill found Michaelmas 1777. Tryed Michaelmas 1777 - Not Guilty.

No518/220 - 24th June 17 George 3 - For a Nuisance in Erecting a Stone and Mud Wall of 25 foot Long and 8 feet deeo in the Highway there. 2nd Count - For the like as part of a Dwelling House erected there. 3rd Count - for another wall 7 foot long and 7 foot deep part of a Dwelling House erected as a Dairy. Further charged on the 10th September 17 George 3 - For a nuisance in keeping 10 Swine Hogs near the Dwelling Houses of divers persons there and near divers Streets and Public Highways. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Michaelmas 1777. tryed Easter 1778 - Not Guilty on all charges.

No238/222 - 14th May 17 George 3 - For assaulting Anna Martin his wife with a Knife with an intent to Murder her. 2nd Count - for a common assault. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tryed Easter 1778 - Not Guilty.

person: Benjamine Boon of St. Thomas the Apostle Sergeweaver
crime: No240/223 - 18th November 18 George 3 - For unlawfully entering the Dwelling House of Eleanor Gore in Cullompton and her expelling thereout and Converting divers of her household goods viz. one Bedstead, 4 Loads of Timber, and 300 of Bricks to his own use. Traversed Epiphany 1778. Bill found Epiphany 1778. Tryed Easter 1778 - Not Guilty.

person: William Clifton of St. Thomas the Apostle Labourer
crime: No526/225 - 29th April 18 George 3 - For a Riot and Assaulting John Jutson Keeper of the Sheriffs Ward. 2nd Count - Common Assault. Bill found Easter 1778. Tryed Michaelmas 1778 - each fined 1d. [comment] All prisoners confined for Debt.

person: John Lambert of Cheriton Bishop Yeoman
crime: No239/229 - 8th June 18 George 3 - For assaulting Josias Locke. Traversed Midsummer 1778. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tryed Michaelmas 1778 - Not Guilty.
No239/231 - 1st December 18 George 3 - For assaulting Amey Payne twice. 2nd Count - etc. Traversed Midsummer 1778. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tryed Michaelmas 1778 - Guilty fined 6d.

No533/232 - 26th March 18 George 3 - For a forcible entry into a part of a messuage called Great Upcott in the Parish of Oakhampton and Expelling Henry Hill from the possession thereof. Traversed Michaelmas 1778. Bill found Midsummer 1778. Tryed Easter 1779 - Guilty fined 1s.
No533/233 - 1st August 18 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting her 2 Bastard Children - ad dmr 40s. Traversed Michaelmas 1778. Bill found Michaelmas 1778. Tryed Michaelmas 1778 - Not Guilty.

crime: No533/234 - 9th March 19 George 3 - For assaulting John Jutsam the Keeper. Bill found Easter 1779.
No533/236 - 14th April 15 George 3 - For unlawfully Deserting his wife and Child and leaving them to the charge of the parish of 10£. Bill found Midsummer 1779.

No533/237 - 29th October 20 George 3 - For Feloniously stealing one Dowlas Shirt ye goods of George Chapman. Bill found Epiphany 1780. Traversed Epiphany 1780. Tryed Epiphany 1780 - Guilty val 6d Imprisoned 3 Months in Gaol or in Bridewell and whipped once.

No533/238 - 1st November 20 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Hurdle val 2s, and 50 feet of Elm val 2s of Richard Cleave. Bill found Epiphany 1780. Traversed Easter 1783. Tryed Midsummer 1783 Not Guilty nor did fly.

No561/239 - 29th September 19 George 3 - For unlawfully harbouring James Guve aged 11 years being aforesaid apprentice to Thomas Trood. Bill found Epiphany 1780. Traversed Easter 1783. Tryed Midsummer 1783 - Not Guilty.

person: John Furler the younger of St. Thomas the Apostle Yeoman
crime: No576/240 - 22nd September 20 George 3 - For unlawfully obtaining from James Mortimore Nine Weather Sheep, One Ewe Sheep, and 6 Lambs under false Prentences. Bill found Michaelmas 1780. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tryed Epiphany 1782 - Not Guilty.

No576/241 - 19th March 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing 3 Pewter Dishes val 3s, the goods of William Hobbs, Gentleman. Bill found Easter 1781. Traversed Easter 1781. Tryed Easter 1781 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Mary Harris uxor Thomas Harris Labourer
crime: No576/242 - 19th March 21 George 3 - For feloniously receiving the last said last Mentioned goods knowing them to be stolen. Bill found Easter 1781. Traversed Easter 1781. Tryed Easter 1781 - Not put upon her Tryal the Principal ffelon being Acquitted.

No576/243 - 19th March 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing Two Pewter Dishes val 2s, one Pewter Plate val 6d, and one Copper Sauce Pan val 6d, the goods of Sarah Ffrancis widow. Bill found Easter 1781. Traversed Easter 1781. Tryed Easter 1781 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Mary Harris uxor Thomas Harris Labourer
crime: No576/244 - 19th March 21 George 3 - For feloniously receiving the said last mentioned Goods knowing them to be stolen. Bill found Easter 1781. Traversed Easter 1781. Tryed Easter 1781 - Not put up on her Tryal the Principal ffelon being Acquitted.

person: Elizabeth Hart of St Thomas the Apostle Singlewoman
crime: No591/245 - 21st March 21 George 3 - For assaulting John Vicary junior and for wilfully and maliciously setting on and encouraging a Bull Dog to seize and Bite him. 2nd Count - For Common Assault. person: John Mitchell the younger of St Thomas the Apostle
crime: No591/247 - 20th February 21 George 3 - For assaulting Joseph Tapley and setting and encouraging his Dog to Seize and Bite him. 2nd count - Common Assault. Bill found Midsummer 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. tryed Epiphany 1782 - Not Guilty.

No591/248 - 4th September 21 George 3 - For unlawfully Soliciting George Pyke (an apprentice to Alexander Norrish) to Imbezzle hos Masters Goods, and receiving two Gallons of Cyder val 1s, and one Peck of Wheat val 1s-6d knowing it to be so Imbezzled. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tryed Michaelmas 1781 - Not Guilty.
No288/249 - 2nd September 21 George 3 - For assaulting John Carter. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tryed Epiphany 1782 - Not Guilty

crime: No288/250 - 9th October 21 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Piece of Ash Timber in Length 12 feet val 6d, the goods of William Iliff. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tryed Epiphany 1782 - both found Guilty val 2d and Imprisoned one Month in Bridewell and discharged.

person: Edward Chamberlaine alias Batten of Huxham Papermaker
crime: No266/253 - 26th September 21 George 3 - For feloniously Stealing two Cast Iron Glazing Balls val 1s, the goods of John Dunsford and Henry Dunsford. Bill found Epiphany 1782.
