Bill found Epiphany 1782. Tryed Epiphany 1782 - Removed by Certiorari.

person: James Stooke of St Thomas the Apostle Woolcomber
crime: No605/256 - 17th December 22 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon John Jutsum. Bill found Epiphany 1782. Traversed Easter 1782.

person: Richard Needs of St Thomas the Apostle Woolcomber
crime: No605/259 - 6th September 22 George 3 - For assaulting Thomas Evans. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Tryed Michaelmas 1782 - fined 1d.

person: Thomas Haddon alias Thomas Haddon Pearse of Southtawton Labourer
crime: No605/260 - 20th August 22 George 3 - For assaulting Mary Lee Singlewoman. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782. Tryed Michaelmas 1782 - Guilty Imprisoned Six Months in Bridewell.

person: Margarett Westcott w/o Thomas Westcott of Topsham
crime: No605/261 - 22nd July 22 George 3 - For Feloniously Stealing Ten Blue and White Nankeen China Plates val 10s, the goods of Alexander Hamilton, esquire. 2nd Count - the goods of a person unknown. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782. Tryed Michaelmas 1782 - Guilty val 11d - Imprisoned in Gaol untill the 19th October, 1782, when she is to be carried to Topsham there to be publickly whipped between the Hours of 11 and 12, and then to be carried to Bridewell there to be imprisoned for three Months from that time.

person: Mary Stiggins of St. Nicholas Singlewoman
crime: No605/262 - 19th September 22 George 3 - For assaulting Martha Stiggins. Bill found Michaelmas 1782. Traversed Michaelmas 1782.

person: Charles Edward Conyere a Lieutenant in the Marines and late a Prisoner in the Sheriffs Ward in St Thomas the Apostle
crime: No605/263 - 22nd November 23 George 3 - For assaulting John Jutsum the Keeper. Bill found Epiphany 1783.
No605/265 - 15th January 22 George 3 - For unlawfully Imbezzling Twenty Six Pounds weight of Obb Wooll the goods of George Lang. Bill found Epiphany 1783.
No605/267 - 26th December 23 George 3 - For assaulting Grace the wife of George Kelly. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Traversed Epiphany 1783. Tryed Epiphany 1783 - both found Not Guilty.

No605/269 - 26th December 23 George 3 - For unlawfully Breaking and Entering the Dwelling House of James Hill, and assaulting him with Swords and Pistols, etc, - and unlawfully Imprisoning him at the Castle of Exeter for the space of 24 Hours; with 2 other counts. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Traversed Epiphany 1783. Tryed Epiphany 1783 - each fined 6d, and Imprisoned three Hours in Bridewell.

No605/276 - 29th April 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Shovell val 1s, the goods of Thomas Trood. Bill found Easter 1783. Traversed Easter 1783. Tryed Easter 1783 - Guilty val 4d - Imprisoned one Week in Bridewell and whipped once.

person: John Luxton alias Luxon of Whitestone Labourer
crime: No605/277 - 4th March 23 George 3 - For feloniously Stealing six ffaggotts of Oak Wood val 6d, six ffaggotts of Ash wood val 6d, and six ffaggotts of Halse wood val 6d, the goods of Thomas Sowdon. Bill found Easter 1783. Traversed Easter 1783. Tryed Easter 1783 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Samuel Prout Labourer a Prisoner of Debt in the Sheriffs Ward of St Thomas the Apostle
crime: No605/278 - 15th July 23 george 3 - For assaulting Isaac Moses. Bill found Midsummer 1783.
No605/281 - 14th July 23 George 3 - For assaulting William Haydon. Bill found Midsummer 1783.

No605/282 - 19th August 22 George 3 - For unlawfully Receiving and Lodging and an Inmate one Elizabeth Wright Singlewoman she being then pregnant with a Bastard Child by means whereof the said parish of Heavitree have expended the sum of £4-16s-10d for the Maintenance of the said Elizabeth Wright and her Child. Bill found Midsummer 1783.

No605/283 - 30th May 23 George 3 - For feloniously stealing one Striped Silk Handkerchief val 3s, the goods of Thomas Trood. Further charged with feloniously stealing 3 pieces of Silver Coin called Shillings val 3s, and 20 pieces of Copper coin called half-pence val 10d, the goods and monies of John Sage. Bill found Midsummer 1783. Traversed Midsummer 1783. Tryed Midsummer 1783 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Degory Mitchell of Gwinap in Cornwall
crime: (see Wonford Hundred Page 245 No 6) - For a Trespass at Honiton. He was a vagrant and sent home by a Pass.

No261/2 - 8th July 1767 - For a Nuisance by Erecting a Gate upon the West End of Tinney Bridge in the parish of Lifton across a common Highway. Traversed Midsummer 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tryed Michaelmas 1776 - both found Not Guilty.

person: Richard Slowman of St. Stephen near Launceston Labourer
crime: No261/4 - 12th February 13 George 3 - For Disobeying an order in Bastardy by Mary Dodd of throwley Singlewoman. Bill found Easter 1773. Tryed Easter 1773 - To be Imprisoned for one year in Bridewell.

person: John Rous of St. Columb Labourer
crime: No261/5 - 8th July 13 George 3 - For assaulting William burridge a Turnpike Gate Keeper at Crediton in the execution of his office. 2nd count - Common Assault. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tryed Easter 1774 - fined 6d.

person: William Long Trosse of St. Stephen near Saltash
crime: No261/6 - 22nd August 16 George 3 - For a Riot and Assaulting upon George Norman, Clerk, and breaking open his Chamber Door at the Kings Arms alias Exeter Inn in Plymouth. 2nd Count for a common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - each fined 3s-4d.

person: John Roberts late of Luxulian Labourer
crime: No261/9 - 8th April 18 George 3 - For unlawfully having in his Custody, etc, 15 Iron Nails val 1s, marked with the Broad Arrow (lain with 4 Counts), and 12 yards of Canvas val 15s, marked with a blue Streak in the middle (4 counts) part of the Naval Stores of our Lord the King. Traversed Easter 1778. Bill found Easter 1778. Tryed Easter 1778 - Guilty Fined 20£ and committed to the High Gaol till paid.

No3/1 - 17th January 1745 - For unlafully Breaking and Entering the Dwelling House of Richard Easton and Carrying away a Brass Pan val 7s-6d the property of the said Richard Easton. Bill found Easter 1746.

No3/3 - Presented at Xmas 1758 by John Long, Hundred Constable of Axminster for Spitting up and Carrying away a Quantity of Turf on Wibble Green in the parish of Membury in Devon doing much Damage thereby and spoiling his plough Tackle.

person: George Dare of Whitchurch Canonicorum Victualler
crime: No231/4 - 27th March 1767 - For a forcible entry into a Cottage Garden and plott of Ground in Uplyme, Devon, in the possession of Elianor Beves, widow, and unlawfully taking and carrying away divers of her goods of the value 10£. Traversed Midsummer 1767. Bill found Easter 1767. Tryed Michaelmas 1767 - Quashed on the Motion of the Prosecutor at Michaelmas Sessions 1767.

person: John Willcocks alias Herred of Stockland Labourer
crime: No231/5 - 13th April 1767 - For stealing one Cock price 6d, and 2 Hens price 1s the goods of John White. Bill found Easter 1767. Tryed Easter 1767 - Guilty val 10d - Transported for Seven Years.

person: John Trott junior of Stockland Butcher
crime: No246/6 - 26th January 1767 - For assaulting William Matthews and Rescuing divers Goods which he had distrained for Rent. Bill found Midsummer 1767. Tryed Xmas 1768 - fined 1d.

person: George Dare of Whitchurch Canonicorum Victualler
crime: No88/7 - 28th March 1767 - For the like offence (For assaulting William Matthews and Rescuing divers Goods which he had distrained for Rent). Bill found Michaelmas 1767.
No88/8 - 25th April 12 George 3 - For assaulting William Broughton. Bill found Easter 1772. Tryed Easter 1772 - fined 1s.

person: James Leaves junior of Chardstock Labourer
crime: No435/9 - 22nd May 14 George 3 - For assaulting John Deane. Bill found Midsummer 1774.

person: Elianor Symons of the Holy Trinity widow
crime: No9/1 - 16th February 1747 - For (Slocking) and Enticing one John Symons Apprentice to Robert leach to leave his Masters Service. Bill found Michaelmas 1747.

person: William Cummings of St. Sidwells Labourer
crime: No10/2 - 14th January 1747 - For unlawfully arresting Roger Tolley and making him pay 5s-3d before he would set him at Liberty. Bill found Xmas 1747.

No133/3 - 29th November 1764 - For a riot at Aylesbear and Assaulting Mary the wife of Jonathan Tobey. 2nd Count for a common assault. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Xmas 1765. Tryed Easter 1766 - both Not Guilty.
No163/5 - 29th October 1765 - For Extortion in taking £3-4s-0d of thomas Martyn for arresting him. Traversed Midsummer 1766. Bill found Xmas 1766. Tryed Michaelmas 1766 - Not Guilty.

No266/6 - 20th July 1767 - For assaulting Thomas Bond at Topsham and cutting to pieces and destroying his ffishing Nett val 5£. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Michaelmas 1767. Tryed Easter 1768 - Joseph Saunders fined 6d; the remainder found Not Guilty.

person: John Fursdon of St. Sidwells Labourer
crime: No266/10 - 15th June (1771) 11 George 3 - For stealing one Mans Saddle val 4s, two Iron Stirrups val 6d, and two Stirrup Leathers val 2d the goods of John Templer. Also charged with stealing one Horse Girth val 1s, ye goods of William Lake. Traversed Midsummer 1771. Bill found Midsummer 1771. Tryed Midsummer 1771 - [comment] The prisoner dropped down during his Tryal and Instantly dyed. His fate decided as above.

No359/12 - 10th July 11 george 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon Grace the wife of Joseph Woolacot. 2nd count for a common Assault. All were furthwr charged for a Riot and Assault upon Emmanuel Hutchings at the parish of Kenn. Bill found Midsummer 1771. Tryed Michaelmas 1771 and each fined 6d.

No361/29 - 10th July 11 George 3 - For unlawfully breaking and destroying the Glass windows of the Dwelling House of Joseph Woolacott at Kenn. Bill found Midsummer 771. Tryed Michaelmas 1771 fined 6d.

No378/30 - 28th April 12 George 3 - For a nuisance in digging a pitt 30 ffeet Long 7 ffeet Broad and 6 ffeet Deep in the Highway called the Quarry Road in the parish of Heavitree. Traversed Michaelmas 1775. Bill found Easter 1772. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - Not Guilty.

person: Thomas Warren of St. Sidwells Sergeweaver
crime: No176/31 - 7th June 12 George 3 - For feloniously stealing and carrying away in the night time 48 cabbage plants val 5s, the goods and chattels of john Adams out of his Garden, con for statute. Traversed Midsummer 1772. Bill found Midsummer 1772. Tryed Midsummer 1772 - Guilty val 9d - No judgemwnt being under 5s val/vide Statute 6 George 3.

person: William Hayward of the Holy Trinity Joyner
crime: No177/35 - 9th March 12 George 3 - For stealing one Mahagony Box val 7s, and 3£-14s-0d the moneys of persons unknown. Traversed Michaelmas 1772. Bill found Midsummer 1772. Tryed Michaelmas 1772 - Not Guilty nor did fly.

No178/36 - 5th November 13 George 3 - For stealing Two turkies val 2s, the goods of William Spicer, esq. 2nd Count for the goods of a person unknown. 3rd Count For Two other Turkies the goods of William Spicer, esq, on the 20th December. 4th Count, for the goods of a person unknown. Traversed Easter 1773. Bill found Epiphany 1773. Tryed Easter 1773 - both found Not Guilty nor did fly.

person: Richard Commings of St Sidwells Exeter Pressman
crime: No178/38 - 26th May 13 George 3 - For feloniously stealing five Wooden Gate Barrs val 4s the goods of Peter Berlon. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Epiphany 1774. Tryed Epiphany 1774 - Guilty val 1d.

person: William Phillips of St Sidwell Exeter Buckmaker
crime: No469/39 - 15th August 15 George 3 - For a Riot and Assault upon John Rowe at Silferton and unlawfully Breaking and Destroying his Glass windows. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - Not Guilty - no evidence given having been before convicted on the following Indictment.

person: William Phillips of St Sidwell Exeter Buckmaker
crime: No470/40 - 15th August 15 George 3 - For another Riot and Assault upon Joseph Head at Silferton. Traversed Epiphany 1776. Bill found Michaelmas 1775. Tryed Epiphany 1776 - Guilty - Fined 5£ and to be Imprisoned in High Gaol for two years and untill the ffine is paid and untill he gives good securityt for his giood behaviour for three years after himself in 50£ and two good securities in 25£ each or one in 50£.

No493/41 - 1st August 16 George 3 - For assaulting Jane the wife of William Vinnecombe and maliciously Riding his Horse over her. 2nd Count - common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - fined 6d.
No499/42 - 20th September 16 George 3 - For assaulting Hannah Hayman at Topsham. Bill found Michaelmas 1776. Tryed Epiphany 1777 - fined 1s.

person: Joseph Mitchell of St. Sidwells Sergeweaver
crime: No507/43 - 24th June 17 George 3 - For assaulting James Bryant and Thomas Coleman and unlawfully rescuing George Moore whom they had in Custody by a Justices Warrant for Bastardy. Bill found Midsummer 1777. Tryed Midsummer 1777 - Bartin fined 1s.

No541/46 - 8th December 19 George 3 - For assaulting Robert Matthews at Heavitree and Rescuing a Sow Pig out of his Custody distrained by Thomas Trood for Damage Faisant, and then Driving to pound. Bill found Epiphany 1779.

person: John Reynolds of Exeter Chaise Driver
crime: No542/47 - 7th January 19 George 3 - For assaulting Humphry Mortimore and unlawfully and Maliciously Driving his Post Chaise against a one Horse Chaise of the pro(secutor) and overturning it, whereby the pro(secutor) was affrighted, and Hurt and Bruised. Bill found Epiphany 1779. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tryed Epiphany 1782 - Not Guilty.

No542/48 - 19th September 21 George 3 - For assaulting George Linscott (then being a Servant to Matthew Tapp of the City of Exeter, Dealer in Spirituous Liquors) at Heavitree and unlawfully seizing and taking and driving away a Horse and Cart together with two Gallons of foreign Brandy, Two Gallons of foreign Geneva, and one Cask of foreign Brandy then being in the said Cart, the property of the said Matthew Tapp, under a pretence that the same were by Law liable to Seizure. 2nd Count - Common assault. Bill found Michaelmas 1781. Traversed Michaelmas 1781. Tryed Michaelmas 1781 - Not Guilty.
No542/49 - 1st January 23 George 3 - For Assaulting John Langbridge. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Traversed Epiphany 1783. Tryed Easter 1783 - Not Guilty.
No542/50 - 11th October 23 George 3 - For Assaulting Joanna Radford. Bill found Epiphany 1783. Tryed Epiphany 1783 - fined 1d.
No12/1 - 23rd June 1749 - For assaulting Thomas Cornish and Elizabeth his wife. Bill found Midsummer 1749.

No96/3 - 13th November 1767 - For buying from John Rowe Seven Pigs for the sum of 17s-6d each as the same were coming towards Exeter Market to be sold - (viz) in the Parish of St. Thomas the Apostle. Traversed Xmas 1768. Bill found Xmas 1768. Tryed Easter 1768 - Not Guilty.

No277/4 - 23rd February 1768 - For unlawfully Removing the Body of William Reed, Junior, (who had been accidentally killed) before the Coroner had taken an Inquisition. Traversed Midsummer 1769. Bill found Easter 1768. Tryed Michaelmas 1769 - William and Alexander both found Guilty and 1s each.

person: Thomas Murren of Chard Horse Dealer
crime: No174/7 - 11th October 11 George 3 - For assaulting William Coleman at Whimple. Traversed Xmas 1772. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tryed Easter 1772 - both fined 1s each.

person: Thomas Murren of Chard Horse Dealer
crime: No175/9 - 11th October 11 George 3 - For assaulting Henry Hatsley at Whimple. Traversed Xmas 1772. Bill found Xmas 1772. Tryed Easter 1772 - both fined 1s each.

No410/11 - 4th February 13 George 3 - For Wilfully Driving his Timber Carriage against and breaking down one of the walls of St. Saviours Bridge in Ottery St. Mary. Traversed Epiphany 1774. Bill found Midsummer 1773. Tryed Easter 1774 - Jennings fined 3s-4d.

No432/13 - For unlawfully bringing and Leaving Lydia Linty and her two Children in the parish of Crediton in Devon to the charge of that Parish of 3£-11s. Traversed Easter 1775. Bill found Midsummer 1774. Tryed Midsummer 1775 - Not Guilty.
No482/14 - 4th April 16 George 3 - For assaulting John Ball. Bill found Easter 1776. Tryed Midsummer 1776 - fined 6d.

No525/15 - 1st April 18 George 3 - For assaulting Timothy Hoare a Sheriffs Bailiff in the Execution of a Warrant and rescuing himself out of his Custody - vide Bampton Hundred. Bill found Easter 1778. Tryed Michaelmas 1778 - each fined 1s.

person: Joseph Mullins of Hinton St. George Officer of Excise
crime: No525/18 - 5th June 23 George 3 - For Assaulting Richard Coplestone. Bill found Midsummer 1783.
No1 - For being an Incorigible Rogue and Vagabond. Tryed Easter 1767 - To be Transported for Seven Years.
No2 - For being an Incorigible Rogue and Vagabond. Tryed Midsummer 1767 - To be Transported for Seven Years pursuant to
